name: Flowerdale (3 Sisters) LZ
desc: North : The paddock is large but slightly sloped away from the hill and as such your approach should be as low as comfortable into the paddock to give you plenty of room. Be aware of possible turbulence from other hills, especially in NW winds. In very light or nil conditions an uphill landing can be successful. South : The landing area is along the Strath Creek Rd in one of the first three paddocks immediately over the creek. Check these paddocks before flying for stock or other obstacles and possible dangers (possible flooding in wet months).

name: Peeralilla Hill LZ
desc:
Two landing options. First and easiest is across road, Beware of power lines to the west of landing, but long strip, easy approach.

Second option is directly in front of the hill. Few trees in the way, and beware of power lines.

name: Long Reef NE LZ
desc:
The sand spit on the point. On the beach in front of the Golf Club next to the lower car park (you only need to be above the ridge at the north western end to make the glide to the beach). Watch the pine trees though, their lower branches reach out over the sand. The boat launch is a raised concrete ramp and quite hard!

If you should get low then it is possible to bomb out on the various bits of sand in front of the takeoff. However at high tide the area of sand is rather narrow.

Top landing is relatively easy, approach from the north west, or south east as appropriate for the bias in the breeze. Take care to look out for spectators as this is a very popular walk.

name: Cooks Terrace LZ
desc:
The beaches to either the north or south of the headland. The park at the northern end when the wind has little to no south in it.

Top landing is very easy, simply approach from the appropriate direction for the wind and make your landing in the front half of the launch area. Take care to look out for spectators as this is a very popular park. Once you've landed, please drop your wing to make it easy for others to also launch or land.

name: Khatabundah LZ
desc:
Not recommended to land in the paddocks below launch as the farmers don't like it.
Designated landing paddock is to the right of the S.E launch. 
You will see a row of trees that follow the access road. The landing paddock is on the OTHER side of this tree line. 
If bombing out make sure you give yourself plenty of height to clear this line of trees.
Emergency landings can use the back corner of the paddock nearest the S.E launch and close to the access road.

name: Bells Beach LZ
desc: PGs can topland on Southside, and in an emergency HGs can topland on Winkipop launch (in front of the road and fence). Otherwise, land on the beaches. Southside (past Bells to the right from Winki) is the closest, but can disappear in a high enough tide. Jan Juc at the surf life saving club to the east, and Pt Addis to the west offer somewhat larger beaches. HGs generally aim to get to at least Anglesea, often with sizeable unlandable sections on the way.

name: Ma Ma LZ

name: Flinders Monument LZ
desc:
Hazards/Comments

The Monument works in an Easterly wind direction and gets a bit wild when it blows up to 20knts. The takeoff can be difficult. DO NOT under any circumstances fly in close to the cliff after take off if you are below the top of the cliff. Landing in the vacant land down the road to the North end of the ridge should only be attempted after discussing the hazards with a local flier. Beach landings are safer, but can still be tricky as it is a narrow beach with turbulence at the base of the near vertical cliff. The Monument site can be beautifully smooth when blowing 14-18 kts and straight on, but we have seen more near serious accidents here than possibly any other Victorian site. The takeoff for paragliders is VERY tricky.

name: Lady Bay LZ
desc: Landing paddock across road from launch, between large trees and the ocean. Very simple landing. Wind is usually lighter or nill down here.

name: The Bluff LZ

name: Cape Liptrap LZ
desc: Top landing only. Large 60m x 20m cleared area to the left of takeoff. From the air the landing area is clearly visible, do not fly beyond the roadway/powerline, you may find penetration difficult and undershoot into the tea trees.

name: Landscape LZ
desc:
North landing: The main North LZ's are, 1. Directly in front of launch across the road, 2. Across the river to the North East of take off. These are a fair glide out so be aware and also familiar with the Bomb-Out option. The Bomb-Out is the sloping paddock to the left (west) of the vineyard at the end of the spine. Set up over the back left hand corner (SW corner) of the vineyard and land between the dam and shoulder. If you think you are going to over shoot, an option would be to turn up the spine and land up hill, possibly light tail wind.

West landing: The main West LZ is across the road from the West take-off (on the north side of the road). It is not hard to reach, unless you are low. This is a long flat paddock 'between the river and the road', (across the road to the right of the homestead). This paddock now has groups of saplings (surrounded by circular bared wire fences) planted within it, and may have horses (ponyâ€™s). Landings are still possible but judgement and correct technique is required. The Bomb-Out (this should only be used for Emergencies) is to the right of the homestead, there is a dam in a gully, set up over it and land across the gully, or on to the uphill slope (be careful as this will be across the slope).

Top landings: Are available behind the tower near the north launch, and in the valley behind the west launch. The following is strictly a guide, pilots must appreciate that turbulence increases expediential as the wind strength increases. 18 knots is said to be the limit. There will be a band of rotor to go through at about 130ft above, this should subside at about 80ft to 70ft, but be careful & ready. From the air you must access the current conditions and choose the sweet spot. If uncertain take the less convenient but conservative (SAFE) option and choose one of the bottom landing areas.

name: Mt Dandenong LZ
desc:
Landing paddocks are very limited, and it is critical that you contact the local club for the latest details. It is also necessary to check the potential options prior to flying.
The best LZ's are private paddocks owned by the Salvation Army. The Pavitt Lane portion of this is a long skinny strip. The remainder of the area is subdivided into smaller paddocks (by fences). Care and an appropriate landing technique is needed for these areas.

name: Donna Buang LZ
desc: It is of PARAMOUNT IMPORTANCE that you are completely familiar with the properties we are allowed to land in. Failure to do so could place this site in jeopardy as there are properties we have been specifically asked NOT to land in. Please make sure you use the contacts below or make sure you talk to an experienced local pilot for these landing options prior to flying.

name: Boree Creek LZ
desc: As above

name: Broome Cable Beach LZ
desc: anywhere on the beach. Or top landing.

name: Rabbit Hill LZ
desc: Launch area, or the beach.

name: Quinns LZ
desc: Beach landing and or the new Top Launch pad.

name: Contos LZ
desc: Beach or grassed BBQ area

name: Long Reef SE LZ
desc:
A planned landing on the beach to the South West is the easiest option. If you should get low
then it is possible to bomb out on the various narrow bits of sand and tidal rock shelf in front of
the takeoff. However at high tide the rock shelf is covered by shallow water. You will be able to 
stand, but the wave action means you could lose your kit. When landing towards the main beach,
there is a low spur which intersects the beach. Crashing into the spur is not recommended. There
is a sandy beach out at the point on which you can also land, however there is some 
compression around the point.
Top landing is relatively easy, however do NOT drift too far back as the rearwards sloping nature
of the land means that some rotor is present behind the launch. You can avoid this by setting up
your landing to touch down in front of the path. Lose height at the lower western end of the ridge
near the beach then approach the launch along the ridge from the west.
If you should get 'blown over the back' then make distance towards the west away from the higher ridge and land in the golf course. You will not be popular with the golfers but you should be
OK.

name: Mona Vale LZ
desc:
On the beach, which often has a very steep slope and space is limited at high tide.
Top landing is OK, but there are areas of rotor near the footpath.

Some constructions have high security status what makes difficulties to fly over it. Ideal to land next to the hotel outside parking, close to the river bank after passing over the electric station. As alternative, less preferable landing, you can land on both side of the river with extra cautions to stones

name: Landing in front of main building

name: Mostar - Planinica LZ
desc:
2 landing fields, both of them are at the edge of town and both are reachable from both take off places. 
1. 'Vihovici' is 160 ASL small 40x70m clean area for landing. 

2. 'Sjeverni logor' 80 ASL is further down the wind but much bigger, must cross over river to get on this landing point and winds sometimes are stronger than on first landing place. 

Both are suitable for beginners. Only Sjeverni logor is suitable for hang gliders.

It's possible even to do a top landing - very easy

name: Coo LZ
desc:
- West take-off the landing place is the big field just under the take-off. Avoid landing at the far end of it, you're under downwind of the hill.
No top landings in the young forest behind the take off.


- South take-off The landing place IS NOT the big field just under the take-off place (forbidden)!  The official landing is in the south direction along the river after the chair-lift and the waterfall. Just under the west take-off. No top landings in the young forest behind the take off.

name: Les 7 Meuses LZ
desc:
1) The two big fields in front of the take-off, between the camping and the speedway.  Donâ€™t fly above the camping at low altitude. Be careful, there are some high lighting posts along the road.  Donâ€™t leave the car on the parking of the bus company.

2) Between the river and the 4 lines road just under the take-off on the right hand side.  Quite long but very narrow place.  It is strongly recommended to have a look at that place before your first flight.  The approach is quite technical and is realized above the river.   The wind is frequently changing and the air is usually sinking above the river.  Leave the car only on the parking on the other side of the road.

If you have enough altitude, you should preferably use the first of this landing place.  It is located few hundreds meters away from the road but it is definitively safer.

name: Rochefort - Rond du Roi LZ
desc: It is located just above the road N86 (in front of the Water-treatment plant).  Use the big prairies with windsocks.  Caution to the cows.  During the harvest only use prairies not cultivated.

name: Terril de Hornu LZ
desc: Small landing place.

name: Prayon LZ
desc: Watch out for the telephone lines!

name: Olne LZ
desc:
Very big, in front of the takeoff. It's turbulent in the centre of the landing area, avoid the zone near the ruins. But in general very easy to land.

Once your canopy is packed. you'll have to cross a river to go back to take off. there is a bridge at the end of the landing zone.
Don't cross the garden. Go on the right, there is a little pad on the left who circles the garden and follows the river.
Don't forget to close the gate.

beware of the dogs, the little one is nasty but pouring some water scares them of.

name: Praia
desc:
Melhor pouso na praia, mas no verão fica complicado com muita gente. Existem alguns terrenos com pouso logo abaixo da rampa, mas um pouco restritos, e mais opções ao sul.

No dia do vôo de teste (de asa delta pano simples Skyway, performance similar a de um parapente B, 9:1~) o vento estava forte, uns 30km/h. Para chegar sobre a praia com segurança é necessário primeiro ganhar pelo menos uns 450m de altitude, caso contrário melhor procurar outro pouso mais perto.

To use any other field (ie. large H.G.field or for students, must make prior arrangement with landowners). Landings on XC generally ok with exception of crops and livestock.

name: Ecoadventure ranch
desc: Located in Nicholson - 8 km S of Golden (Hwy 95). Can be unreachable in PG in a south wind. Alternatives available.

name: Woodside LZ
desc: The 'Riverside LZ' is located 10 minutes hiking time south of the Lougheed Highway junction with the FSR. There is a trail out of the field through a neighbors property starting near the NW corner of the field leading to the Cafe. If you open a gate close it behind you.

name: Cochrane LZ
desc:
Primary landing location #1: Bottom of the hill
Vertical drop : 88 meters (288 feet) to the 
Distance over land: 0.46km (0.28 miles)
GPS: N51 11 39.14, W -114 27 05.77
Notes: Ample wind socks all around location.  Grass can get tall, some weeds and small bushes throughout.  Barbwire fence around landing perimeter. Uneven slopes in the landing zone.

Alternate Landing Location #2: Across the highway in the baseball/football fields.
Vertical drop : 110 meters (370 feet) to the 
Distance over land: 0.72km (0.45 miles)
GPS: N51 11 29.54, W -114 27 07.66
Notes: Ample wind socks across the highway at landing location #1.  Grassy landing location is well maintained.  Watch for chain linked fences. 

Alternate Landing Location #3: Southwest side of Cochrane at the football field and anywhere north of that location along the park path between highway 22 and the commercial retail on the west side.
Vertical drop : 161 meters (528 feet) 
Distance over land: 2.86km (1.76 miles)
GPS: N51 11 14.02, W -114 29 12.50
Notes: Ample Canada flags can be seen from commercial establishments close by and one wind sock north of the football field attached to a gas pipeline asset.  Flat grassy landing locations are well maintained..  Watch for fencing, power lines and pedestrians in or near the public fields.

name: Dennis Beach LZ
desc: Top land (novice) or beach land (beginner)

name: Mont-Edouard LZ
desc: A very large parkingplace not in use.

name: Ymir - Mt Dundee LZ
desc:
The main HG / PG landing field is difficult to approach and the air is often rough, prone to quite a bit of turbulence. Good approach skills are needed. The old LZ is now closed as the Forest Service has replanted it. Land  at the Ymir Whirl disc golf course just above it (Nth) Expert skills needed particularly for HGers. 

PG may land downtown Ymir (at the campground or beside the river) in zero wind conditions ONLY. Downtown is a turbulaent, rotory mess if there is any wind in the valley. The flag on the Fire Department roof downtown will show false direction with wind speeds above 3kph.  

HG landing zone is on the bench above a large replanted mill site on north side of town on the Porto-Rico-Ymir Rd. 
PG Landing field is downtown across from Ymir Store and Hotel - this favorite drop in spot has liquid refreshments right across the road. 
 - This (PG) LZ is a really tight field, surrounded by power lines, trees and a river.

name: Robotham Ridge LZ
desc: Landing for this site is in two spots either Joes field or Mikes farm

name: Salt Spring Island, Bruce Peak LZ
Mount Prevost LZ
desc:
Main LZ surrounded by high tension power lines stay well away.

Keep gate closed (cattle).

name: Fox River LZ
desc:
beach or top land at TO only!
The beach at most tide times is unobstructed. Access back to launch is achieved by either climbing the bank to the east of launch using the rope provided or by walking to the road two hundred m. to the east.

note - do NOT cimb the bank in front of launch. It is highly suseptiblle to erosion.

Top Landing is possible and is usually the landing of choice for pg. Keep in mind to land closer to the launch ramp to avoid the rotor found toward the rear of the set up area.

DO NOT land in the blueberry field next to the launch.

HG beach landing only!

name: Vista Mountain LZ
desc: There are many fields to land in as well as XC potential. Please check with local pilots before flying here. Most famers are friendly, but we want to keep it that way.  There is a suitable landing zone at Burma Road as well as place to park a retrieval vehicle.  Be cautious of the smaller power lines at Burma Road, especially if the sun is in your eyes.

name: Sodbusters LZ
desc: Most common landing is the field directly below launch. There are several optional XC landings in both directions.

name: Little Fox Lake LZ
desc: Landing is tight. There is a boat launch as well as a couple of clear areas beside the highway. In an emergency, the road could be used, but is not recommended.  See the link to the photo for a view of the boat launch landing. http://www.panoramio.com/photo/18014136

name: Eagle Site - Jakes Corner LZ
desc: The most common LZ is the same location where the mining road starts off the Alaska Highway.

name: Minto Landing LZ
desc:
Lots of choices by clear areas beside highway. 

View of landing with tower (launch) in distance: http://maps.google.com/maps?source=earth&layer=c&cbll=62.571096,-136.818178&cbp=13,59.94,,0,11.51&ie=UTF8&ll=62.571089,-136.8146&spn=0.000005,0.01295&z=17&panoid=-DtDIGAUbyxYYmhO67uZIQ

name: Stewart Crossing LZ
desc: There is a gravel pit below launch. Again, this site is untested and this is only theoretical.

name: Klondike - Tombstone Campground LZ
desc: There are several landings to choose from. Some are less bush than others.

name: Klondike - Tombstone Goldensides LZ
desc: At trailhead or several XC options.

name: Dawson - Dome LZ
desc:
Land at the grass strip beside the Yukon River.  The LZ MUST be approached with lots of height above power lines (City Bylaw).  

500ft min over town, set up for final. Caution with power lines on the town side and river on the other side of the only suitable landing zone. 

This is a locally regulated site and visiting pilots are encouraged to check in with local pilots before flying. Many years of hard work has gone into developing a relationship with the town and local authorities.

View of LZ with Google Street View: http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&q=64.0594N,139.439W&ie=UTF8&ll=64.05985,-139.438004&spn=0.007143,0.025899&z=16&layer=c&cbll=64.060005,-139.437902&panoid=9ptU_9sPgpOiU6FnQpjxqg&cbp=12,9.41,,0,-0.59

name: Fraser Lake LZ

name: Carcross Desert Training Hill LZ
desc: Land anywhere in desert.

name: Teslin Tower LZ
desc: By Lake/Highway.

name: Richards Roost LZ
desc:
On the lake (winter)
On the beach (Early summer).

name: Haines Junction Paint Mountain LZ
desc: A large gravel pit is halfway between the top of the mountain and the local airport. The airport is nearby and can be used for landings but should be considered a last resort or emergency, ideally anyone planning to land at the airport should talk to them first.

name: Three Guardsmen Pass LZ
desc: Several choices beside the highway.

name: Mountainview LZ
desc: Safest landing is on frozen Yukon River.  There is a lower bench that can be landed on for a shorter hike. Some pilots have top landed (not recommended). Do NOT attempt top landing or lower bench if wind speed picks up due to rotor.

name: Tally-Ho LZ
desc: There are no trees up here which gives many options. There are several launch-able sites f the mountain, but if you donâ€™t top-land, ensure you have a way to get your vehicle back down the mountain. Landing is possible on the Annie-Lake Road if you launch off the Northern size of the mountain (long drive).

name: Dawson - Dome North Launch LZ
desc:
Land at the grass strip beside the Yukon River. The LZ MUST be approached with lots of height above power lines (City Bylaw). 

500ft min over town, set up for final. Caution with power lines on the town side and river on the other side of the only suitable landing zone. 

This is a locally regulated site and visiting pilots are encouraged to check in with local pilots before flying. Many years of hard work has gone into developing a relationship with the town and local authorities.

name: Pt Burwell LZ
desc: Top landing is the dominant choice.  The slope is steep sand runnels and there is very little to no beach.  Rotor on top as well, so not great for beginners.

name: Blue Point LZ
desc: No landing on strong wind days because the lakes water level is all the way up to the ridge. Must Top land on take-off

name: Bridal Falls (Lower) LZ
desc:
The paraglider LZ is in a small field beside a golf course, close to the freeway.

http://www.westcoastsoaringclub.com/sites/bridal_falls_lower.php

name: LaFramboise LZ
desc: There is a large field huge between the parking lot and the montain;

name: Mont Pelneault LZ
desc: three possible landing zone ; the further one is a large field 700 m of the takeoff; Sometimes it is difficult to reach it if you loose to much height near the mountain; Another zone in face of the take off at about 600 m of take off ; the last zone is near the mountain between two roads and electric wire; must be cautious...!

name: Bald Peak LZ
desc: Road

desc: beach

name: Red Head LZ
desc: beach or top Landing

desc: dirt road

name: Florenceville LZ
desc: big

name: Hidden Falls LZ
desc: LZ for both HG and PG is the developed and grassed field on the north side of the highway (same side as launch) There usually is a windsock at either end of the lz. Alternatively hangliders can land on the other side of the road although the field is quite grown up with bushes

name: Cape Chignecto LZ
desc: Beach. Caution - Extreme tidal range

name: Economy Mountain LZ
desc:
The PG bailout LZ here is very small and also it is slightly down hill. It is directly in front of launch. It is no good for hang gliders. The hang gliders must land beyond the road and then in the field bordered in green.

The main lz is bordered in green and it can be made quite easily by the modern paraglider in a straight glide from the hill at launch level. If you are below launch you may have to land in the bail out zone.

Please take note if the lz is in crop do not land there. There are probably alternatives.

Dangers
Power lines.

Special Notice. The landowner of the section in red is not friendly to the sport. Please don't land there except under extreme emergency.

name: Half Island LZ
desc: The beach at high tide is very small. Unsuitable for hang gliding and very tight for paragliders. Top landing is only advisable for the skilled and that close to the cliff edge as there is a significant backslope with much rotor depending on wind speed.

name: West Bay LZ
desc: Beach. Caution - Extreme tidal range. (See endnote)

name: High Head LZ
desc: Large open fields with several other usable fields nearby. Some of these fields could be in crop. Best to check with the landowners in the LZ before heading up to launch.

name: Hugh's Brook LZ
desc:
The LZ is a grassy beach but gets smaller with the rising tide... or Atlantic Ocean Ice in Wnter. At least one person needed to be rescued before hefloated away. (Still trying to decide if this distance should be added to his total XC Distance.)
Tides at Corner Brook: http://www.marees.gc.ca/eng/station?sid=2680

name: High Perspective Tow LZ
desc: Very large open mowed grass areas.  Crop fields and roads surrounding.  Fairly flat.

name: East Point Park Scarborough LZ
desc: Top landing at take off spot is preferred.  Beach landing below short bluff is also possible and there is a winding path along the beach back up to the top via the back of the ridge; this is generally not preferred due to distance.

name: Centennial Park Etobicoke LZ
desc: Mowed grass in the park.

name: Brennan recreational farm LZ
desc: Large fields all around each side of the road in front of a huge lake.

name: Riverdale Park LZ
desc: Wide open mowed grass field.

name: Kings Forest Park Hamilton aka The Nest LZ
desc: Side landing near top after soaring or top landing or shrubby meadow to left at bottom off of golf course.  The golf course below is not an option; the golf course management do not tolerate landings on the course when open, so winter only.

name: Atlin - Monarch Mountain LZ

name: Cathedral Bluffers Park (Toronto) LZ

name: Westover Training Hill LZ

name: Mt. Sima LZ
desc: Use the lower parking lot or Coal Lake Rd.  If you are going XC, there are some fields and alternative landing sites.  During summer, the landing can be very thermic and is not recommended for beginner pilots during active conditions.

name: Primary LZ
desc: This field gradually slopes toward its south end, so when landing in that direction give yourself a lot of room for your final leg. Alternative LZs include the highway, a portion of which is closed during winter months, and the riverbed which is rocky but landable.

name: Anarchist (Osoyoos) LZ
desc:
Elevation LZ: 910' asl
GPS: N 49Â°02'34' W 119Â°26'35.00'

Contact a local pilot before going up to check out landing possibilities particularly the beach LZ on Reserve Property.  During summer months, overflow RV Parking can eliminate any possibility of landing at this beach. Alternate beaches during peak tourist season must then be used. Example: Hike out beaches north of the LZ.

Please do not do anything that would jeopardize our efforts to secure this site. A Landowner WAIVER has become required.
This site is a hyper sensitive landing site area. LZ's have been secured and lost repeatedly for decades.

Pilots can land on the hay field just before the switch back on Hwy 6 heading east out of Osoyoos.
Pilots also land on the Osoyoos Beach at the south end of the lake during off season / low use periods.
- check the beach first. Cement walls for lawn areas now barricade parts of the beach.

Alt LZ for XC flights is the Oliver Airport. HG & PG should be well aware of this and be alert and watchful for Aircraft.
Below 2000' stay on the West side of the Runway DO NOT cross to the East side of the Runway.
Hang gliders and Paragliders set up on the west side of the airport and land on the grass strip South of the airport office.
Planes set up on the East side of the airport and land on the runway.
OBSERVE THESE RULES so HG & PG may continue in this already sensitive area.

Landing Road Name and Direction:
March 7th 2012 - Peter Rasumussen has negotiated with the Osoyoos Indian Band http://oibdc.ca/ to secure permission to land here once again.
In fact they very much are looking forward to the flying traffic as they are able to see the value in it as a tourist attraction for their resort winery and golf courses.

Other Information:
Nkâ€™Mip Desert Cultural Centre http://www.nkmipdesert.com

name: Mount Mac LZ

name: Dawson - Sunnydale LZ
desc: Once you launch, there is decent lift in East wind and you can soar for hours in the right conditions. The Landing can be anywhere the river is frozen. If you land near the ice road, you will likely be able to get  a lift back up by a friendly Dawson resident. In summer, you must cross the river and land at the at the designated LZ. You must leave the ridge with sufficient height to make it there. Be sure to have an emergency knife to cut away lines in the event of a moving water landing.

name: Diefenbaker Training Hill LZ
desc: Land anywhere you like in the middle of the park (Watch for foot traffic)

name: Haeckel Hill LZ
desc: Primary south landing is a moderate sized field. Good approach from either side. There should be a windsock, but may need to be put back up. If flying there in spring or summer, have bug spray as you the black flies at the LZ can he horrendous.

name: Schwatka Lake LZ
desc: Landing is possible anywhere on frozen Schwatka Lake during the winter or spring.

name: Havelock LZ
desc: On run way, wind gradient present

name: Little Nic LZ

Large open grass field at 100'(30m) just to left of launch. In strong conditions can also land in grass field on south side of tracks.
Try to land near the road so the grass doesn't get flattened.

name: Ripley LZ
desc:
Be sure not to land in front of launch as this is a sensitive habitat for the burrowing owl.
You must land across the road and in the open field near the entrance.  No vehicles allowed inside the fenced area.  Very large open LZ.

In spring and summer Ryder Lake  landing can be turbulent between 10 am and 6:00 pm. Fraser Valley landing is smoother but a long glide when inflow winds are present.
Lots of landing alternatives in the Fraser Valley.

In Winter there is an official landing area on the north side of the monestary in Engelberg, in summer the landing area is east of the monestary. It is maked with a windsock.
There are many fields in the entire valley which are suitable for safe landings, respect the vegetation, do not land in crop or high grass!

name: Zermatt -Rothorn- Blauherd- Sunegga LZ
desc:
'Zermatt' Landing Zone: DEMANDING/ SPECIAL RULES!!!
* Located approx. 2 min walk North from the Zermatt Train Station.
* Relatively small landing area with good approaches from the North and South.
* IMPORTANT! Special conditions apply with flying in Zermatt since the landing site is only 500m from heliport.
* Contact Paragliding Zermatt if unfamiliar with flying site: +41 (0)27 967 67 44

name: Roldanillo - Los Tanques LZ
desc:
Chances of top landing, landing in the valley floor or at the base of the mountain.
Given coordinates are for 'Stadium' in centre of town. Avoid landing at the Stadium in the afternoon, as very often after 1400 the west wind enters and makes landing turbulent; also often difficult to exit the satdium, as it may be closed...
>> Alternative: 'la pista': 76.121083W; 4.412383N: here the west wind will be most likely less turbulent, This LZ lies right beside the road Zarzal-Roldanillo and it's easy to catch a ride or a bus back to Rldanillo.

Hay una gran amplitud de campos planos donde se puede aterrizar. Unos de estos terrenos estan inundados y pueden tener lodo. Es aconsejable de atterizar cerca de la carretera que lleva a las ruinas que estas abajo de la montan~a. Nueva construcciones se estan occuriendo, cambios de atterizaderos seran necesarios.

A long walk can be very painful because of the high temperatures. The official landing is situated in the valley. At the bottom of the hill there is a long, grass covered field. Take care of the trees.

name: Dora LZ
desc:
Normally, when we gain enough height, we land in fields on the river plain near  the village of Kidasi  or top landing on the left of the take off ( be careful), or in front of the take off on the right there is a small clear  field with vineyards. As we descend to the level of the lower cliffs, about 400â€™ or 500â€™ above the actual river bed, and downwards to the ground we encounter an area of general turbulence due to upstream airflow (valley venturi) colliding with convection. Thermals are strong but disorganized here. Descending into this air can be exciting, annoying and, closer to the ground, spooky. It may play havoc with your landing approach and some interesting whacks occur here from time to time. We recommend good airspeed and conservative approach planning.
top landing available
optional landing : The bowl in front of the  launch contains some slopes and small fields that do not have obstructions and are landable if the need exists. These fields arenâ€™t necessarily dangerous and novices have landed here. However, they are tight and oneâ€™s approach has to be good, else the surrounding grapevines become quite a problem.

name: Cirium (Kourion) LZ
desc:
The Curium LZ is the area directly out from the sandpit launches to the beach road. We urge all pilots to land on the ridge side of the beach road at all times. This is a busy place in the summer. The beaches are crowded, the beach side of the road is full of cars and those driving on the beach road always invade your approach corridor after you are committed. They even stop right in front of you to watch! 
There is a large field off the end of the ridge. Do not use this field as it thoroughly aggravates the people who work the land. They have some goats and horses there and believe that the gliders scare the daylights out of the animals. Please respect their wishes.

name: Petra Tou Romiou LZ
desc: There are different landing areas depending upon choice. You can land on one of the several car parks that are along the main road, or you can opt to land on the beach. However, the beach is in places quite narrow and has a sheer cliff immediately above it, so caution should be maintained.

It's also clearly visible from the take-off along with a host of other similar landing fields dotted around it.

name: La Silla (The Chair) LZ
desc:
There are several points that can be used as a landing. The main one is along the road, near the point where the dirt road to the take-off starts. It is owned by a local family who has prepared it for this. 'El Flaco', the land owner, can give you information about how to reach the take-off, arrange local transport and care for your car if necessary. It is a poor family so any tips would be welcome.

[ES] Existen varios terrenos que pueden utilizarse como aterrizaje, el principal es de una familia local el cual lo tiene adecuado para este motivo, 'el flaco' dueÃ±o del terreno podrÃ¡ darte informaciÃ³n de como llegar al despegue, contactar con el transporte local y cuidar tu auto de ser necesario, es una familia muy humilde por lo que cualquier propina serÃ¡ bien recibida.

name: Aterrizadero de Lumbisi
desc:
Landing Zone Perfect for any type of hang glider or Paraglider.

2km from Take off

name: Imbabura volcano LZ

name: 2do Valle

name: Landing
desc: green area

name: Tabasalu LZ
desc: Landing is on a beach right of the take off 200 meters.

name: Paldiski LZ
desc:
Common landing is top landing. It is easy and safe near the take off area. 
Emergency landing is just under the take off. It is a narrow beach line. 
Better not to launch if the wind is less then 6 m/s.

name: Turisalu LZ
desc: Common landing is top landing. Other option is to land on the beach near the cliff and climb back to the starting point.

name: Kakumäe LZ
desc: Nice place to land. Not huge, but for a pilot capable of flying such spot is big enough.

name: Organya LZ
desc: Can be turbulent, specially in the southern part near the trees and the river, so it's better to land closer to the mountain and piloting actively to counter any collapses at low altitude.

name: Pepe's Bar
desc:
Several wide fields below: 
- Levante: most people land at  'Pepe's bar'...
- Norte: LZ by the road to launch

name: Otivar LZ
desc: Really tricky landing, lots of thermal activity surrounding the landing, It is best to use the road to track off your height and then follow the road in.  To the left of the road normally has a lot of lift and to the right was a lot of sink, but this does vary.  No low turns!  I saw numerous heavy landings and one broken leg because of this.  Best approach is to come in hands up because of the turbulence caused by a row of trees.

name: Castejon de Sos - Liri LZ
desc: In the airstrip or in the field right next to the cementery, which has better wind conditions and it's closer to the village.

name: Lanzarote -Famara (Tequise) HG-TO LZ
desc: TOP landing for PG's possible; beware of rotor with high winds!

name: Rasos de Paguera LZ
desc: Cross south to the usual landing place or plenty of fields to choose otherwise.

name: Pedro Bernardo LZ
desc: The landing runs East to West and it is very long, hanggliders have no problem landing here. When the wind (rarely) comes in from the South you have to watch out, it has a telephone line running along its North side and a high-tension line running along its South side. This is usually not a problem because the wind comes in from the West 90% of the time

name: Tenerife - Taucho LZ
desc:
near the Tropicana next to the motorway:
2 landing spaces, one smaller next to the parking, one bigger behind the parking.
Both with wind indicators

name: Cenes de la Vega (Granada) LZ
desc:
very long and wide, ok for beginners
Don't fly low over the road !
Study info board at LZ, which shows the areas which are not be be overflown, resp with at least 150/Gnd!

name: Carchuna LZ
desc: Beach

name: Mancha Real
desc:
Main LZ is in Mancha Real; Bail-out LZ available (>> see Map)
Landing behind TO is also done.

name: Ager LZ
desc:
- Vertet Landing Field.
It is near the Camping Vall d'Ager. There is a sign befor the oange fuel station opposite the 'Bar Torres'. It is a rectangular field of 200 x 50 m., West - East oriented. It now has wood beams in the parking lot. Carefull with the turbulence of the trees with North wind and if in trouble use any of the other massive landing options nearby. Wind sock on top id the campsite that also has flags.
GPS: 31T 315079 , 4652814

- Cal Maciarol Landing Field.
One of the biggest of the valley. It's near the road to the take off. Good for all wind directions. It has all the services: Bar, accomodation, paragliding school and shop...take care with power line on Main road Its a really good option with a pig farm. It has an small aeroplane that also uses the landing and lands towards the hill in a North direction. Nice big wind sock and streamer.

- ALTERNATIVE LANDING FIELD. (known by 300's field)
Is a landing field situated in front of the take off 'Coll d'Ares'. They are one height more or less than 300 m. from the take off . It is used when not enough height to get to the valley.

Ager valley has many great landing fields. Please respect crops in the field and no smoking in the fields in Summer as its Fire risk.

name: Gistredo LZ
desc:
Wide landing area located in Robledo de las Traviesas.

Don't park any car in landing fields, parking zone it's in the other side of the road.

When grass is high try not to smash it a lot because owners of the fields can be angry.

name: Lanzarote - Orzola- Mirador del Rio LZ
Lanzarote - Arrieta LZ
desc:
At the beach near Arrieta or at the HG-LZ in front of TO: N29 06.873 W13 28.313
TOP landing possible (PG: also at carpark on the other side of the dam).

Better to see this with local people as it is very technical. pozer lines are around and there are thermics all around. it is just much eaier to pick people up back, but not worst a twisted ankle!

name: landing
desc:
En la duna o Mina.
con un Aladelta, se puede aterrizar en la playa o algo mas atrás en las dunas. fácil, no debería tener mucha complicación, las dunas si son irregulares y hay algo de vegetación, pero no hay arboles ni tendidos eléctricos.

Landig is located in the base of Pico Muelas.
The landing is usually done near the little bridge as cars are usually left there, although there are several camps around, the only caution is that you have to be a little careful with the high voltage line that has been put recently. You should also avoid the pine forest on the hillside. If you fall short of the take-off, it is possible to take off on the small plateau just below the take-off.

name: loarre LZ
desc:
On the fields near to the Loarre castle.
On the fields near ( 820 m agl) to the camping  there are two fields , one small and a bigger one near to kids playground. Both landings zones are next to the road that takes you to the Takeoff.

There's also the possibility to land on the field near the top which is quite big. So it makes an unusually easy top-landing spot. But for that some ascendency is needed to go above the takeoff.

name: Sa Torre - Cabo Blanco LZ
desc: You ussually will land at top. Emergency landings at bottom.

name: Chia LZ
desc: Out front of the S launch is very flat, with many unfenced large fields. We normally land in the large field with the goalposts. From the SE take off you sometimes do not reach the football field. There is a suitable landing field next to the road going down.

name: La Lastra del Cano LZ
desc: Lastra is a spine backed ridge, so it is easy to go over the back and land on the main N-110 highway where there are plenty of large easy fields. Normally on an evening flight we will all Â¨go over the backÂ¨ and try to get to as close to Piedrahita as possible along the main road. In front of the hill the fields are generally smaller fields and though they are generally easy for a paragliders, they can cause some stress for hang glider pilots.

name: Las Mallolas LZ
desc:
Top landing possible and recommended, but following this approach : you have to come from the west, i.e. have the windmills on your left, fly over the takeoff which should be then on your right, make a U turn and then land. 
Despite what you may think, there are no turbulences at all, and toplanding is usually nice and easy.

If top landing is not possible (not enough wind), it is possible to land on the dirtroad 200m below, that you can see if you look from the cross.

name: Zarautz LZ
desc: Top landing

name: Cabarga LZ
desc:
At the foot of the mountain, near the road comfort, but where there are many spaces need to take land, or in the same off if conditions allowed us to fly above the takeoff. 

En la falda de la montaÃ±a, por comodidad cerca de la carretera, pero en caso de necesidad hay muchos espacios para tomar tierra, o en el mismo despegue si las condiciones nos han permitido volar por encima del despegue.

name: Huergas de Babia LZ
desc:
Numerosos campos para aterrizar en las proximidades de Huergas de Babia.
PrecauciÃ³n con los pastos, cuando estÃ©n altos procurar aterrizar al pie de la ladera donde existes campos comunales de monte sin aprovechamiento ganadero. Localizables en las cercanÃ­as de una nave ganadera justo al pie de la ladera donde se vuela

name: Monte Ventoso LZ
desc:
toplanding solo para pilotos experimentados, la parte superior del despegue esta ocupada por las ruinas del antiguo observatorio meteorológico, el despegue es amplio pero está rodeado de tojos(vegetación) altos.   Abajo en las dunas o playa es fácil y sin complicaciones. hay un tendido eléctrico y farolas, no son un estrobo y no suponen ningún inconveniente. 
con un Aladelta tomar en la playa o en las dunas no supone ninguna complicación.

name: Acebedo LZ
desc:
El aterrizaje oficial estÃ¡ situado justo al lado de la Iglesia, sin embargo es necesario revisar antes la existencia de campos de hierba aun sin recoger. Los dueÃ±os de los prados nos dejarÃ¡n aterrizar siempre que usemos campos destinados para pasto de animales no para la recolecta.
Official landing is close to the church. Ask to local population where is the field to use

name: Sant Pere de Rodes LZ

Landing: Cooperative-Saverdera Palau. Medium difficulty. Attention to road and power lines that pass through it. Predominant wind sea (SE).

Landing: Beach of Puerto de la Selva. Attention people in summer. Predominant wind sea (NE). Alternative landing next to the tennis courts on the road from Selva de Mar and on the ridge that descends to the village, the fields beside the road

ALCAUDETE TOWN

desc:
In the slope near the road on the other side is where we parked the car, (is most comfortable).  Or in the same off if you have enough height and conditions permit.

En la falda de la montaÃ±a, cerca de la carretera que por otro lado es donde habremos aparcado el vehiculo, (es lo mas comodo).
O en el mismo despegue si se tiene suficiente altura y las condiciones lo permiten.

desc:

Aterrizaje muy amplio de hierba entrando por la parada de autobus que hay en el centro de Islares hasta llegar a la costa, hay un amplio aparcamiento al lado del aterrizaje. Cuidado con un cable que vÃ¡ a la casa que hay al lado del aterrizaje.

Visit before flying! (Cables!!)

Landing place has got approximately square shape, relatively small. Visit is must for first timers here. 

Flairs use to be in the corner close to road and also in opuncia cactus in the middle of LZ.

In last year there appeared some artificial jumps for mountain bikes. Mountain bikes share the same take off and landing zone and are approaching the LZ with full speed so watch out to avoid collision.

Wide area to land between mountain and Rodiezmo town

possibility to land on top, see information sign at landing.

name: Port LZ

name: Crozet
desc:
Coordonnées GPS : 46.2758 ; 6.0131
L’atterrissage est à 560 m, il est grand, dégagé mais thermique.
Il est strictement interdit de survoler les maisons en rouge, les tennis, l’école et les aires de jeu.
Il ne faut pas non plus faire les bases trop près de la route pour éviter de distraire les automobilistes et de déranger les riverains.
Il est utilisable quelque soit l’orientation du vent, mais il faut faire attention à ne pas poser sous les rouleaux des arbres suivant l’orientation du vent.
Stationnement OBLIGATOIRE sur les parkings de l’école ou de la salle du Rossillon .
Atterrissage de secour sur le chemin en face de la salle du Rossillon.

name: Stade Jean Rolland
desc: forbidden, when stadium is in use!

name: Moustiers Ste.Marie - Mt.Denier LZ
desc:
large, can be bumpy during summer afternoons (> see weather hazards)
Snack bar available

Other LZ below 'Courchon' available: can be seen from 'Courchon'-TO

name: Saint Vincent les Forts LZ
desc:
in spring and automn, you can land on the beach near the lake, but this become a camping at summer and landing there is not allowed !!!
the official landing is the field next to the take off : fly if you think you can land on top.
Top landing may be tricky because of rotors if you go to far behind the landing field : stay as close as possible to the wind side of the landing.

name: Les Richards
desc: I never use it, please complete this subject.

name: Orcieres LZ
desc:
down in the valley, close to karting track
in narrow valley where strong breeze is blowing in the afternoon : be careful.

name: Puy Aillaud LZ
desc:
Near the 'Les Chambottes' campsite.
Park your car before the campsite.

name: Laragne - le Chabre LZ
desc:
Main landing at the camping place in Laragne-Monteglin: N44.31228 E5.83495, 570m

Two intermediate south landings on the way up, visible from the take-off: South landing 1 in large clearing at the foot of the Chabre, surrounded by trees but simple and safe in most winds - can get bouncy in strong thermic conditions; 
South landing 2 halfway up on the side of the road, rather short but not incredibly difficult: N44.29021 E5.76719, 970m

North landing to the NE of the mountain large and well signposted: N44.32000 E5.79139, 600m

name: Aspres LZ
desc:
at the (Glider-)Aerodrome of Aspres-sur-Buech.
Note the marked LZ for HG/PG.

name: Sospel - Agaisen LZ
desc:
Turbulent, strong walley wind, strong gradient.
Not for beginner in summer afternoons

name: Gourdon LZ
desc:
Domaine de St. Ambroise, a small private field E of takeoff equipped with a windsock at the lower end (slight slope). Possible to walk back up in about 30 minutes. The owners of the landing field do not wish speed flyers to land there.

Valettes, in the distance below Bar s/Loup. Usually unreachable in summer due to strong valley winds, this is used commonly in winter for extended sled rides, this landing is suitable for hang gliders.

Top landing, either on takeoff itself (easy on the upper one, tricky on the parking one) or on the old roman track on the plateau behind the parking takeoff.

Outlandings are tricky (urbanized area to the south).

name: Monaco- Roquebrune- Mont Gros LZ
desc:
From takeoff, follow the road back down to La Turbie and turn left at the main road. 
Follow this road until the junction where you see the big, dominant hotel. Take a sharp right hand turn back on yourself at this junction. 
Follow this road to the T-junction, where you turn left. 
Follow this road, and go straight across at the first set of traffic lights, crossing the main road, into a smaller road opposite. 
Follow this road round the valley. At the other side, take the right-hand turn that is signposted for the railway station. 
Drive down this road to the bridge over the railway. The road then goes left to the station - park around here, and take the steps on the right-hand side down to the beach.

name: Greolieres LZ
desc: The big meadow to the east of the village.

name: Thorenc - Col de Bleyne LZ
desc:
alti: 1120m
The field is very big, and has streamers or a wind sock near the road. The wind here can be coming from either the East or the West - there is a convergence point that moves backwards and forewards. 

Please pack up at the edge (not the middle) of the field.

name: Auron LZ
desc:
alti: 1600m
Landing is in the fields below the campsite at Auron.

name: Déco Baisse de Raymond (Veillos) LZ
desc: This is a large field next to the campsite at St Dalmas. (There are goalposts to watch out for at one end).

name: Pic de Brau LZ
desc:
Finesse 5 nÃ©cessaire pour arriver Ã  l'atterrissage. 
Les 3/4 du vol se faisant en ascendance dynamique, cela ne pose en gÃ©nÃ©ral aucun problÃ¨me. Mais en cas de conditions dÃ©favorables (vent nul), il ne faut pas trop laisser descendre devant le dÃ©collage si on veut atteindre l'atterrissage avec un peu de marge.
Atterrissage lÃ©gÃ¨rement petit situÃ© entre les vignes.

name: Millau - Brunas LZ
desc:
Atterrissage en contrebas. 
Bien préparer sa finale. 
Observer la manche à air qui peut être différente de celle du décollage.

name: Officiel

name: Saujac LZ
desc: very easy

name: La sainte victoire LZ
desc:
Auberge de Saint-Ser
Puit d'Auzon

name: La Roche a Bunel LZ
desc:
on the top, far away from the takeoff for hanggliding.
in the valley (very wide).

name: Brezons LZ
desc:
Wide landing field with an (air indicator) on the barrier near the middle.

On the right of the road before Brezons, straight on the road leaving the takeoff. Can be seen from takeoff, but not easily noticable, please have a go on it first.
The end of the field can be drawn with water. And the beginning is under the influence of the trees on descending wind.
Do not land on the fields nearby, this one is large enough.

Speak with the locals and peasants if seen.

name: Vic sur cere LZ
desc: very easy, many possible landings

name: Station Super Lioran
desc: Be careful with the ski Facilities. Landing prohibited in winter

name: Puy de la tourte Est LZ
Puy mary - nord est LZ
desc:
Easy LZ; exact location of LZ to be verified!
Do not hesitate to visit 'l'auberge du Buron d'Eylac' (owner of LZ)

Site nÂ°: 19A009, mis Ã  jour le 26/11/2009

clear area in the middle of lavanda crops, parking nearby

North: (N44.22536 E5.50354, 820m) Villefranche-le-chateau, next to the cemetary; west-wind can become strong in the afternoon

near the village, a big landing. Another one (small) is just below take off, look at the picture.
If local pilots could write here more information please...

name: Clamontard - Luc-en-Diois LZ
desc:
from Luc-en-Diois:
follow direction Valence or Die (north),
after 1 km turn left at a big intersection with signs Poyols, la Motte Chalancon
after 500 m you will see a sign (vol libre) and turn left. park the car, walk 50m and you are on landing

name: La cote des deux amants LZ
desc: Atterissage trÃ¨s facile malgrÃ© une rangÃ©e d'arbre et une ligne electrique visible du haut.

name: Barneville sur seine LZ
desc:
The Landing at 49Â°23'29' (49.3915)N; 0Â°51'7' (0.8522)E is badly overgrown and tiny. Also the neighbors appear to love barbed wire, which they spread generously along the river path. The local map states an auxiliary 'atterisage delta' (49.392013, 0.860188). well, I suggest everybody should have a look into that one. otherwise, if the water is low, the banks are wide - and rocky.

The path to the landing leaves the main street about 150m east of the start. it's a long, steep path but - if the upper gate is open - passable for cars.

name: La roquette LZ
desc: No landing allowed anywhere in the flats between the slope and the Seine. Top landing in the slope mandatory, or behind the take-off, away enough from turbulence!

name: St samson de la roque LZ
Tuchenn ar kador LZ
desc: In front of the car parking area, between bushes.

name: Menez-Hom (Menez Hom) LZ
desc: alti: 250m  or toplanding

desc: On the top, or the beach

name: Saint Come LZ
desc:
On the take off : there's a lot of space !

An emergency landing is possible too: north of Village

name: Mont Bouquet LZ
desc:
East, main landing (Le Triangle)
South, beware of the road and trees around, (Le Mas Cremat)

name: St Dionizy LZ
desc:
Top landing easy : be carefull ! Don't go behind take-off

Little landing near cycle-road

name: Pompignan LZ
desc: Inclined landing ...(near the road where it turn right) but you can also land on the 'parking', where you will park your car 50 meters on the right of the takeoff, it's easy

name: La Seranne - Déco France LZ
desc:
The main landing spot is 6 km to the north-east following the mountain in 'Coupiac' (this is the prefered landing spot, and is also the pickup point for the shuttle).

If landing in Coupiac is not possible a backup landing spot is just at the bottom of the takeoff (direction NE) at a site called 'Les Prats'

name: CLARET LZ

name: Jas d'oris LZ
desc: near the D114a road, between oris en ratier and La Valette. From Oris en Ratier, after a few km (1 or 2), landing on your right. Be careful of turbulences near the ground, in the valley.

name: Chalais LZ
desc:
The old landing near rugby stadium has moved to a field near ChÃ¢teau de Beauplan.

Visit landing at first : to check for farming (hay) and thermal wind.

Thermal wind comes quickly with sun and can be strong (from 9:30 to 12:00) then fly there in the morning or in stable conditions.

Flying over national road is vorbidden !

Definitively not a landing for beginners.

name: Villard - cote 2000 LZ
desc:
near cablecar,
turbulent in strong conditions!

name: Colombiers d'Entraigues LZ
desc:
Alti:900m
from Entraigues village direction 'Le Perrier'. Landing 200m on your left.

Perquelin, in a small valley east of St Pierre, take care about thermal winds ...
Saint Hugues, 5 km south of St Pierre, big landing, sometimes too far with south wind.
Pictures on 'Grand Son' site: http://www.paraglidingearth.com/en-html/index.php?site=7255

the dike or 'la Mirande'

alti: 950m

St Pierre d\'Allevard, just on the north shore.
alti: 500m.

From Mens, go to the south (D66 then D216). Cross 'Saint Baudille et Pipet', 'Les Marceaux' and turn to the right along westbound fields.

desc:
'Saint Martin d'Uriage': alti 550m; looks rather big, but due to the many fences is actually rather small (and tricky if there is lift near the ground)!
Near the primary school. Park your car near the gymnasium.

name: Le Grand Ratz LZ
desc:
East exit of La Buisse,
5 km W from Voreppe.
On the right side of the road when leaving La Buisse to Voreppe.

Very big, no danger...

except with south wind that may become quickly strong ! caution !

name: Montaud LZ
desc:
Landing in a field with trees on borders... and possible turbulent conditions...
Careful when approaching.
Please park only at the public parking and walk your way on the reserved path only, Si tu respect to the locals and fields

name: Les 2 alpes LZ
desc: Alti: 1650m, near the ski station (begin of 'le Diable' ski-lift) or in the end of the valley, near 'Venosc' village (alti:900m).

name: Cherier LZ
desc: easy

name: Chaspinhac LZ

name: Luzech LZ
desc:
land in the field right of launch, in the bend in the river. It is the only field to land in, the rest is wine vines. 

windsock present.

name: Douelle LZ
desc: The landing is directly to the north across the river. Its a north south running strip of grass and borders on the road. If you get low on the east side of the bowl, there is a field, bordering the river, to the east of the designated landing. Watchout for the poweline in that case.

name: Penne d\'agenais LZ
desc: To the north west, there is a small field, next to the road and just after the railway lines. A windsock is usually present. Beware the powerlines.

name: Laparade LZ
desc: Landing is next to the castle.

name: Nicole LZ
desc: Land next to the train tracks, in the town football field. Take care from the north-east, to have enough height to make it there.

name: Sion - vaudemont LZ
desc: In the field right down the take off.

name: Donon LZ
desc:
550 meters.

On road D993 at the place called Le Paquis.

Same landing zone than Haselbourg(W).

Located at the intersection of the road RD45 and the RD98c.

Large area between 2 crystal manufacturers.

name: Auteuil LZ

name: Olhain - Parc d'Olhain LZ
desc: * The landing field is private and only allowed to paragliders.

name: Frencq LZ
desc: After the fields have been harvested (early September) there is unlimited landing but beware of damaging crops earlier in the year.  There is enough grass at the bottom of the slope to land and this also means one less fence to climb over.

name: Puy de Dome LZ

name: Accous - 500 LZ

desc: Anhaux

desc: Plateau de Sancher

name: Vallee du louron LZ
desc:
Easy landing area by the lake
Take care of mountain breeze
>> South wind very dangerous!!

name: Hautacam -la Bergerie LZ
desc:
Lac des Gaves:
landing on EAST side of lake is PROHIBITED!
(> map)
ATTN: valley wind (from North) can become very strong!

name: Pla d'Adet LZ
desc:
Vignec
Access: To take the road of the Thermal baths then to turn right after the bridge.

Flying conditions: Federal landing. Not to land except ground (another place, the neighbours wont accept it).

Dangers: strong thermals winds in summer after midday. Phone line in edge of road. south Wind very dangerous .

Vignec
AccÃ¨s : Prendre la route des Thermes puis tourner Ã  droite aprÃ¨s le pont.

Conditions de vol : Terrain FFVL. Ne pas atterrir hors terrain.

Dangers : Brise forte en Ã©tÃ© l'aprÃ¨s midi. Ligne tÃ©lÃ©phonique en bord de route. Vent de sud trÃ¨s dangereux.

name: Mauroux (Pic dels Moros) LZ
desc:
landing in the field next to the wind socket.
be careful the field is in light slope : don't land facing the valley even if you face the wind you ll risk to fly over the landing. Prefer to land facing west or east, with slightly side wind but following the 'ground level lines'.

name: Altenberg - rocher du coucou LZ
desc: Big and wide, no problems

name: Belmont LZ
desc:
Secure landing is top-landing.  

Landing at bottom near the curve of the road is possible but very small and turbulent. Not for beginners.

Landing in the valley (eg: Waldersbach) is possible with no wind and a glide ratio > 8, but not official.

name: Reinhardsmunster LZ
desc:
280 meters.
500 meters before Reinhardsmunster on the left (from Hangwiller). Take the small path, park the car. The landing zone is the second field (by the hill).

name: Gustiberg LZ
desc:
Don't fly over the camping.
Landing zone at URBES camping.
http://lavl.free.fr/site-parapente-vosges/Urbes.html

name: Schnepfenried LZ
desc:
Difficult and small.

Located in sondernach at the entrance of the village (from the take off) : turn right on the first road and it's 100 meters on your left.

Parking at the landing zone is strictly forbidden.
Park your car at the intersection and walk.

Only half of the field is the official and authorized landing zone. Avoid the other part.

name: Treh markstein LZ
desc:
Fellering Aerotec or Carrie (Oderen).
Height : 450 meters.
Description of aerotec landing http://lavl.free.fr/site-parapente-vosges/Aerotec.html

Description of La Carrie landing http://lavl.free.fr/site-parapente-vosges/Carrie.html

name: Quincié en Beaujolais LZ
desc: Royal ... (large and easy)

name: Uchon LZ
desc: Top landing possible, but tricky!

name: L'ebaudiaz LZ
desc:
alti 330m
Juste near olympic's site, near the 'Gilly/Isere' swimingpool.

name: Val Pelouse LZ
desc:
on the 'val-pelouse' road, stop at the 'Molliet' village. Big information board on your right, don't forget to read the rules.
Thermals in the LZ, be careful. Be friendly with neighbours, don't fly over their houses.

name: Montlambert LZ
desc:
Alti:270m
Be careful about the power line, the trees and the train way. Landing zone is South/South-West of the windsocks! Please look at the information posted at the carpark.

CURRENTLY THE LANDING SITE IS IN DANGER! PLEASE CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS AND NEVER LAND OUTSIDE THE LANDING FIELD IN THE CROPS OF FARMERS!

name: Montagny
desc: If South wind is also reaching ground, better use Brocolis and avoid this one

name: Montagny
desc: Warning, by South wind in the valley, this landing might be uncomfortable beeing on the lee side of "Les Monts", it is then better to land at Brocolis

name: Courchevel (Bouc Blanc) LZ
desc:
Primarily Le Praz in winter. 
La Tania (on the red piste near the main carpark) is possible but more technical. 
Bozel but this is below the ski lifts for returning in winter but is used more outside the ski season.

name: Chamoux LZ
desc: Very large landing field with parking, at left hand site on the road to chamoux sur gelon. (parking is at right hand site)

name: L'épine - lac d'aiguebelette LZ
desc:
near the entrance to the highway, on your right. Be careful, this area is fragile. Pack your glide under the trees, near the parking.
Conditions : Unless you happen to be there by strong Est wind ("Le Farou") where you might find uncomfortable lee side landing, it is rarely windy, its position makes it protected from most winds.
This landing is also called "the Swamp", if you attempt landing during winter (January to March) you might be displeased by the 10 to 20cm mud waiting for you.

name: Bande LZ
desc:
From 'Les Echelles' go to Chambery (N6 road). Just before tunnel
Landing CLOSED, and so, take off closed !

name: Bisanne Sud LZ
desc:
Landing at "la Pompe" before arriving in Beaufort alti: 700m
from Albertville go to Beaufort (D925). Cross 'Villard sur Doron' and stay on the same road. Just after the crossroad (Les Saisies/Beaufort) turn to the left. Landing area is just near a big shed.

name: Chedde
desc:
Two landing sites exist: Chedde and Merlioz, both just 1km apart.

Merlioz site is much bigger and suitable for hang gliders. Chedde is smaller, more technical but still suitable for beginners.

Merlioz site is on the way from Passy to Le Fayet (big field on the right, access from other side): 45°54'57''N - 06°42'21''E 

Site identified on the map is the Chedde site.

name: Agy plane LZ
desc: fly straight out from Chevran and about 500m into Cluses you will see a landing area marked with a big T on the grass, sometimes there are camper vans there so make the most of a safe area anywhere in the valley to land.

name: Le pont de zone
desc:
'Le pont de zone' : 46Â°10'53'N - 06Â°12'60'E
Level : beginner / delta
Location : In front of the eastern part of the Salève (Petit Salève).

'CVLG - Centre de Vol Libre de Genève':
Level : beginner / delta
Location : Official landing of the club-Swiss (Troinex).

name: La Clusaz LZ
desc:
At the bottom of the Etale lift, under the cables. Small but not difficult.
Or near the Confins lake.

name: Les carroz d'araches LZ
desc:
Araches for all pilots:
from the village, go to 'Les Carroz' and stop your car near the advertising 'atterrissage vol-libre'. Follow the signs.
Les Carroz (Les Flocons Verts) only for good pilots:
enter in 'Les Carroz' ski-station. On the first xcross road turn to the left and stay on this road. turn to the right after, and stop near a big grass field.

name: Plan Praz/ Brevent (Chamonix) LZ
desc:
usual LZ in Chamonix: Bois du Bouchet - not visible from TO.
ATTN: this LZ is VERY close to the (year round) no-fly zone LF R-30A! To be on the safe side, make your approaches from the north side of the main road!
Alternative-LZ: Savoy (relatively near gondola), but prohibited in winter.

name: Chatel Morclan (summit) LZ
desc:
alti: 1100m
Near a tree nursery, under the village center. Follow the signs or ask in the paragliding shop, on the center place.
use the footbridge after parc your car, to cross the trees nursery.

name: village
desc: LZ 'les Potais': more info here: http://en.legrandbornand.com/paragliding-summer-landing-area-les-potais.html

name: Mieussy LZ
desc: Large field just outside Mieussy; windsock

name: Varan dit  "Pobu" LZ
desc:
Be careful the landing at the north of the lake of Passy is closed. You can only land on the little graveled path.
Strong valley wind after 13h00

name: Doussard
desc: Doussard, near the cross road with Annecy and Planfait.

name: Marnaves - parapente LZ
desc: Comitted landig between poplar trees.

name: Cazals LZ
desc:
Attention, l'attéro déclenche en conditions thermiques fortes.
Be careful : the landing can be turbulent by strong thermal conditions.

name: St Antonin Noble Val LZ
desc:
Safe landing in fields below if you fail to get enough lift to return to takeoff point.

Atterrissage en toute sÃ©curitÃ© dans les champs en dessous, si vous ne parvenez-pas Ã  garder assez de portance pour revenir au dÃ©collage.

name: Signes - siou blanc - la limatte LZ
Signes - agnis LZ
desc: near the road, in the valley

name: Lachens West LZ
desc:
Use \'camping\' landing (43.7219 N; 6.62667 E) if you have enough altitude.
If you don't, land at \'Mike\' (43.72666 N; 6.635833 E)

name: Le Mai - Cap Sicié LZ
desc:
Same place as take off.
Warning, few escape place for urgent landing due to sea directly under the take off.

name: Ste Anastasie LZ
desc:
Large landing place, with car-park.
You must take care of downwind due to the forest on south part, high gradient when the wind is strong.
In the afternoon during summer time, be careful of strong thermals in front of the landing area.

Details here: 
https://www.tasie-parapente.club/le-site/

name: Ballon d Alsace LZ
desc:
Easy landing on top.
NW and NE take off are very large and easy.

The NE can be seen from the takeoff. Wind direction can change withhin seconds, recheck right before landing. Beware of the cables along the street, yet they are isolated due to bad experience...
This field is hard to find by car, as it is located behind a sawmill.

The E landing zone is the landing zone called SEVEN between the 2 lakes.

name: Chevre roche LZ
desc:
Ne pas poser quand les herbes sont hautes.
Poser directement sur le parking ou dans le champs au bout du parking

name: Lumbin
desc:
in Lumbin, in the village's entry when you come from Grenoble.
Top landing by north winds (or breeze) near the principal road at the 'syndicat d'initiative', near the big parking.

name: Plan de l'Aiguille (Chamonix) LZ
desc:
usual LZ in Chamonix: Bois du Bouchet - not visible from TO.
ATTN: this LZ is VERY close to the (year round) no-fly zone LF R-30A! To be on the safe side, make your approaches from the north side of the main road!
Alternative-LZ: Savoy (relatively near gondola), but prohibited in winter..

name: Allevard-south takeoff LZ
desc: if the south wind is too strong to come back in the dyke, go to 'la mirande' landing. It's on the 'la Rochette' road when you are in Allevard. It's on the border, after La Mirande's lake.

name: Allevard-les Plagnes LZ
desc: the dike or 'la Mirande' as you want.

name: Chatel Morclan (under the top) LZ

use the footbridge after parc your car, to cross the trees nursery.

name: Volmerange-les-Mines LZ

In the field just below take-off.

Don't land near the houses and in the field behind the starting place.

name: Serpaton - Gresse en Vercors LZ

Well, there are many fields around. This site is essentially interesting to xc flights...
Be careful, to land in a field with grass already cut !!!

http://lavl.free.fr/site-parapente-vosges/Urbes.html

Really small, to the left close to the track.

Pay attention to farmers cows. The field next to the round-about, you cant miss it, flying out you will see it to the left of the little oval dam across the road, it has rocks  cordoning it off with a small streamer closer to the river.

landing down in Centron if the valley wind has established any time after 11am can be hazardous, strong- due to the venturi.

Le Coin

Top-landing possible and easy. Cows are in the fields around the take-off from may to october.

you've got choice :
Syndicat landing in Saint hilaire village,

alti:840m

Park your car near the last field, it's the landing area. Be friendly with neigbourgs, and land out of fields with horses or other. This site ISN'T official.

name: Leucate -Sémaphore Falaise EST LZ
desc:
Landing is on the Take Off :
On your right, when you'll take off, you'll see a little natural stone wall witch enters during 40m inside the land. It's your landmark. <For landing :
Come back to the south and keep 20 meters high minimum, turn just before the wall, fly on the left and follow it. On the top there is a road witch go right. Turn right and follow the road. Keep it just on your right not to fare. After 30 meters there is a little land like a sheep stone parking. Make several 'S' and land here.
It's possible com from the north to land too.
