name: Bell Hill LZ
desc:
It is possible to land back on the launch area. Please watch out for gliders
launching who should be giving way to you on your landing approach.
The launch area can be very buoyant and on stronger days it is advisable to
land in the field behind the windsock when not in crop.
Slope landing is usually straight forward here. However, you must ensure you
know your into wind beat.

name: La Pulante LZ
desc: Beaches to land on when the tide is down

name: Aonach Mor LZ
desc:
As this is a big xc site landings away from this site are the most common.

Landing at the bottom is ok but can be a bit much for inexperienced pilots despite the large area of ski car park under certain conditions.  Strong sea breezes (westerly or south westerly)  may develop in mid to late afternoon and be in a different direction to the high level met wind causing wind shear.   Large trees surround the car park and can cause mechanical turbulence in these conditions.

World Cup Mountain Bike events and other large mountain bike events sometimes fill the car park so that it is impossible to land safely.   In this case you should go elsewhere to take off.

Info from here
http://www.nevisrange.co.uk/winter/gondola/gondolaindex.asp

name: Meall nan Tarmachan LZ
desc: Close to the car parking 1km below the dam

name: Ben Ledi LZ
desc:
No official landing

Usual landing is on the W side of the main road near the group of 3 caravans.    There are several narrow but ample fields here between the river and the minor road leading to the holiday cottages.    You can also land on the minor road (if the fields are boggy) as traffic is usually very light.

Alternatively there is a large field on the E side of the river not far from the carp park although this field is immediately to the S of a large hillock and should probably be avoided if there is a strong N breeze coming down the valley (rotor potential)

For SW type winds, common, head down towards Loch Venachar, ample fields on N shore of loch, but be aware of livestock and small power line along road.

name: Bushwhack ridge LZ
desc:
In the fields at the S end of Loch Lubnaig on either the E or the W of the river

Alternative landing halfway up Loch Lubnaig on the E shore.

name: Beinn Leabhainn (Burger Van) LZ
desc:
Landing is tricky as there is limited space near the car park with small trees now growing up in the clear patches.

An alternative landing is approx 1km N of the car park but this also has powerlines to contend with.

There are also several normal power lines and a high voltage power line (pylons).   Work was starting to underground the high voltage line in spring 2009 which should make this site quite a bit safer.

This is not a beginner or inexperienced pilot site - recommended BHPA Pilot or above

name: Campsies LZ
desc: Land near the car park

name: Myreton - Ochils LZ
desc: Menstrie Playing field (Dumyat Centre) if not in use, or any fields without crop along the A91 - do not land in fields with horses - respect Lambing Restrictions (see website).

name: Luss LZ
desc:
Not for beginners this is the field with powerlines on 3 sides that you walk through immediately above the parking area.

Landing in Luss village has been done but can cause problems

name: Ben Dorain LZ
desc: Where you want

name: Gargunnock LZ
desc: Grazing fields as marked, or closer to take-off

name: Bukies landings
desc: Please do not over-fly the farm to land near the cars

name: Craigend LZ or nearby
desc: There are lots of big open fields by the parking area, choose one clear of crops or livestock

name: Kaim Hill - Fairlie LZ
desc: Land beside the carpark

name: Gyrn Moelfre LZ
desc: see web link

name: Loch Walton (Todholes)
desc: Numerous large grassy fields in front of the ridge.  Avoid the ones with long grass near the loch.  They are usually boggy.  Try to avoid the sheep.

name: Culcreuch / Fintry
desc: Beside the small loch near Culcreuch Castle hotel.  Beware of the large trees. There are plenty of landings possibilities in fields in the valley; avoid crops and livestock.

name: Whitesheet LZ
desc:
Top Landing
 There is a massive safe top landing area - but this is closed when the field is in
crop.
If this field is cropped you must either slope or bottom land or land back on
launch. There is likely to be lift over the launch area as it is still on an upward
slope. Beware venturi when landing here which may result in being dragged
back into the fence.
Bottom Landing
Any grass field at the bottom of the hill can be used as long as it does not
contain a long grass crop or livestock. Speak to Mr or Mrs Jeffrey to check
availability.
Watch out for power lines.
There may also be single-strand electric stock fence across the middle of some
of the fields. Check before going up the hill.
Close and latch all gates, even if you didn't open them.

name: Beinn Liath Mhor LZ
desc: Landing is restricted near Achnashellach by the large numbers of trees.  There is huge easy landing area to the south east of the ridge.

name: Liathach LZ
desc: You can land almost anywhere in the glen but watch out for cables.

name: Heol Senni LZ
desc:
Top landing in front of the wall is quite tricky for hangliders but it is okay to land behind the wall if necessary(except behind the quarry where turbulence may be encountered).
Hanglider pilots may  bottom land on the flat area  next to the track on the north side of the road.

name: Fan Gyhirych LZ
desc: Bottom landing is possible at the bottom of the bowl and below SW takoff. beware of the gully when landing by the layby

name: Rhossili LZ
desc: On or behind top takeoff, on lower takeoff or on the sandy beach. Do not land on any green area above the beach.

name: Lletyn Gors LZ
desc: Top land anywhere, fly along ridge to the east for bottom landing by junction

name: Cox Tor LZ
desc: Good , but beware boulders.

name: Hepburn Wood LZ
desc:
Take care if top landing behind the walled section there is rotor. Don't go down in the trees. The trees produce rotor and turbulence in a strong westerly. 

Bottom landing (HG) the field slopes down into wind ! best to come in as low as possible as to avoid over shooting.

name: Lossburn Reservoir back of Dumyat LZ
desc: Wide choice of landing in flat moorland to west and south, though avoid going too far SE and getting close to the reservoir. Mature forest to SW some 600m from take off.

name: Ross LZ
desc: Please don't land in this field if there are sheep in it during lambing time.

name: Talybont LZ
desc: Please see webpage for details. PLEASE BE CAREFUL WITH TOP LANDINGS AS THE STEP FACES (APART FROM NW TAKE-OFF??) CAN CREATE A ROTOR!!!

name: Abington LZ
desc: Anywhere in the valley or in the field next to the car park.

name: Hillend LZ
desc:
The landing site is a flat, grassy area to the East of the chairlift (please have a look before you fly as it is not visible from either take off). This landing option can be turbulent in a strong SE wind. The ground to the west of the ski centre and south of the golf course offers a large but rough landing option best suited to lower airtime pilots.The golf course can be used in an emergency but beware of golfers, pack up quickly on the side of the fairway and offer your thanks and/or apologies to any golfers present.

** Note that the ski slope is being extended so for now the landing is to the West of the the ski slope, just next to the golf course **

name: Fairbourne LZ
desc: On the beach

name: Afton Down LZ
desc: see:http://www.flywight.co.uk/

name: Beinn na Feusaige LZ
desc: Landing is possible anywhere in the valley bottom, though watch out for the electricity cabales which are easily visible.

name: Knockfarrell LZ
desc: This is essentially a soaring site and top landing is the best way to avoid a slog back to to the car at the end of a flight. However there are plenty of landing options down in the valley, though many fields will contain livestock or crops at certain times of year so please apply common sense when choosing where to bottom land.

name: Little Wyvis LZ
desc: There are numerous landing options, either low on the slopes of the hill  or, with a little height above take off, it is possible to bottom land in the meadows beside the Black Water River.

name: Ben Wyvis LZ
desc: Landing options are plenty.  When flying the NW (main) face of the hill, it is best to land either at the foot of the hillside before the forest, or, given sufficient height gain ATO, in the meadows beside the Black Water River.

name: Cairngorm LZ
desc: Bottom landing is possible around either the main Coire Cas carpark, or in the ski centre overflow car park.  If landing in the carpark, bear in mind that it has a slight, but deceptive, downhill gradient and very gravely surface.

name: Beinn nam Ban LZ
desc: Landing is straightforward on either the rough ground near the car parking or, better, on gentler terrain close to the road, midway between Badrallach and Kildonan.

name: Ledmore LZ
desc: Landing spots are plentiful.  Watch out for electricity wires running alongside the road in places.

name: Quinag LZ
desc: Bottom landing is possible anywhere at the base of the slope, although the ground is very rough in places.

name: Sail Mhor LZ
desc: Bottom landing is possible on very rough ground in vicinity of the parking area.

name: Meall a Bhainne LZ
desc: Landing is possible anywhere, though for convenience it is common to bottom land near the car parking

name: Beinn Bhan LZ
desc: Landing is possible anywhere at the base of the hill, though the ground is, pretty much without exception, very rough throughout.

name: Beinn Eighe LZ
desc: Landing is possible pretty much anywhere in the glen, though watch out for the power lines that run alongside the road.

name: Creag nan Clag LZ
desc: Bottom landing next to the road.

name: Tom na Gruagaich LZ
desc: Landing is possible anywhere on the lower slopes or in the general vicinity of the carpark.

name: Slieu Lewaigue LZ
desc: Good top landing with bottom landing on beach or towards Maughold.

name: Fionn Bheinn LZ
desc:
A convenient landing spot can be found just on the eastern side of the village of Acnasheen on what remains of the old road, but it is possible to land pretty much anywhere in this area providing care is taken not to disturb livestock.

If you are not landing on the old road, beware of the very boggy ground in places and watch out for the power cables that run alongside the main road.

name: Meall Gorm LZ
desc: For those launching from Meall Gorm and not going XC, it is most common to bottom land either at the old docks on the shore of Loch Kishorn or, better, further along the shore nearer to the road leading back up to the pass.  This gives a 2300ft top to bottom flight of around 5km.

name: Bealach na Ba LZ
desc: For flights from the Bealach na Ba it is usual to land anywhere on the open hillsides (though be wary of the line of power lines running down the Pass itself).

name: Coire a Chaorachain LZ
desc: For flights from Coire a Chaorachain it is usual to land anywhere on the open hillsides.

name: Perran Sands LZ
desc:
Top Landing Notes: HG pilots must be aware that the site slopes toward the sea and top landing in lighter winds needs care. On approach NEVER fly over or behind the caravans where there is sink and rotor.

Bottom Landing Notes: Easy except at highest tides but watch the wind direction along the beach.

name: Isle of wight Pearl LZ
desc: Top land or land on beach. Check state of tide. There may be Buffalo in the field behind take off - but we are assured that they are friendly !!!

name: Limerstone LZ
desc: No Bottom landing but should be able to side land along the ridge at a number of points if experienced.

name: Chillerton LZ
desc: Slope landing along the full length of ridge and the main ridge in front of take off.

name: Luccombe LZ
desc: Bottom landing on the beach although now work has been carried out January 2011 it is possible to top land or use the field behind take off.

name: Arreton LZ
desc: Paragliders top landing is OK but beware of the busy road behind take off. Bottom land in fields as long as they are without crops.

name: Culver LZ
desc:
Top landing to the right of car park. 
Beach: Check the state of the tide before you fly. Land on the beach near yaverland car park or on top in the lower car park overflow field next to the sailing club compound.

name: Maes Knoll LZ
desc:
Top Landing: Do not land in any crops.

Bottom Landing: Below take-off, but watch out for the barbed wire fences.

name: Coward's bowl LZ
desc:
Bottom landing is only possible if the field below take-off is not in crop. If a disaster happens and you do land in the crops walk out causing the minimum amount of damage and apologise to the farmer at Wood Farm. On a paraglider there is plenty of space to land within the bowl area, but take care to avoid the small tree plantation at the very bottom.

Top landing:
Can be difficult on a hang glider as the space is restricted. Land on the spur to the west in a SW-WSW wind or just behind the bowl in a S wind. Do not leave your glider in a place where it becomes an obstruction to others trying to land. Do not worry any farm animals that may be in the field. Paragliders can land in the bowl area. Be aware of the barbed wire fence and the numerous thorny bushes in the bowl. Do not land in any other top field or in Spencers Bowl.

name: Eype LZ
desc:
BL: On the beach if the tide is out.
TL: somewhere back away from the edge because of rotor.

name: La Pulente HG LZ
desc: Top landable on the left hand side of the site. Avoid the obvious large areas of clear ground, it's rough there.

name: Les Platons HG LZ
desc: Top landable. Very rocky (boulders!) narrow beach below. Very not recommended for hang gliders. Ok for paragliders. Beach 'next door' at Bonne Nuit is better but still not recommended for HGs. Fly on the wall'able for HGs

name: Greve de Lecq LZ
desc: Top landing on the clay pigeon range

name: Noirmont LZ
desc: Field behind take off.

name: Vicard LZ
desc: Probably should be regarded as top landable only except for the most dune goonable gliders such as the Malibu.

name: Jardin D'Olivet LZ
desc: Top Landing only for hang gliders except the very slowest types. Same rocky 'beach' landing as that for Vicard i.e. avoid if at all possible. Top landing is big.

name: Portelet Common LZ
desc: Reasonably easy top landing. Beach landing is small and rocky for modern hang gliders

name: Lobster Pot L'Etacq LZ
desc: Top landing can be a little rough. Bottom landing is the wide sweep of St Ouen's bay. Almost nobody could fail to land OK on this

name: Les Landes Smelly Bay LZ
desc: Solid rocks down below. Top landable only (HGs). One can fly back and top land on the Jersey Model Aero club landing strip.

name: Bonne Nuit LZ
desc: Top landing is highly preferable for HGs - though the rocky narrow beach is OK for slow HGs no-one would want to go down here.

name: Rybury LZ
desc:
Slope land, or top land as appropriate, but see hazards.

The bottom landing area is the field just beyond the fence at the bottom of the slope (see area marked on map).

name: Leckhampton Hill LZ
desc:
The field is divided into 3 by barbed wire fences and there are open gates between all the fields. (Please use these open gates to get towards the house to exit. Do NOT climb over fences). There will be sheep grazing in there. The fields slope down to the middle quite a lot and are sheltered from the west and have a copse of trees on a rise in front. Not too easy to get down into. If there is any wind to speak of, there may well be rotor behind the trees and the ridge
Â© Malvern Hang Gliding Club

name: kintail LZ
desc: There is a large open area at the botom with  parking area.

name: Woolacombe LZ
desc: Large top landing either at takeoff or in the field behind. Bottom landing options inculde a small grassy area in the sand dunes or a 2 mile long beach!

name: Corn Ridge LZ
desc: Slope / top landing or anywhere on Dartmoor that isn't being used for live firing by the Royal Marines!

name: Fraserburgh Beach LZ
desc: On the beach.

name: Pleinmont West LZ
desc: No bottom landing.

name: Pleinmont North West LZ
desc: Bottom landing available but limited. Top landing is possible in field to West behind bunker or back on take off.

name: Pleinmont North LZ
desc: Landing available at bottom of hill. Landing also possible on Portelet or Rocquaine beach.  Top landing onto take off area is possible but difficult due to restricted size. Top landing also possible in camping fields behind the trees on top of ridge - beware rotor if landing close to trees.

name: Icart LZ
desc: No bottom landing. Only top landing available. Avoid fields with cattle or horses nearby.

name: Jerbourg (Seaplane Bungalow) LZ
desc: No bottom landing. Land in field behind site (which can have rotor if wind off to East) or on Jerbourg Hotel lawn at rear.

name: Les Tielles LZ
desc: No bottom landing. Land back in take off field.

name: Goat Site LZ
desc: No bottom landing. Land back in take off field.

name: Herm Island LZ
desc: Land on edge of sand dunes behind Shell Beach.

name: Jerbourg (Viewpoint) LZ
desc: Top land in field to the North next to burned out old hotel.  Bottom landing is possible but not recommended.

name: Lansdown LZ
desc: There are a few different fields to land in as long as you can clear the bushes, and make sure you check the way out of the landing field

name: Cam Long Down LZ
desc: Bottom Landing: The car park area. Beware that the ground slopes away towards power lines and houses! If in doubt ask

name: Kimmeridge LZ
desc:
Top Landing  There is rotor in the top landing fields particularly in the first 200 yards behind 
the wall. This is extremely dangerous for hang-gliders in winds above 18mph. 
hang-gliders should use the Kingston top landing fields but should always be 
prepared to be dropped 20 ft or more during approach. Land well back. 
Paragliders should ideally land within 50m of the wall behind the stile.  
Toward Swyre Head it is possible to top land in most fields if you find the wind 
is dying on you. Beware, as you will almost certainly experience some degree 
of rotor. Only use this option in emergencies. 
Avoid landing in any cropped field or where animals are present.  
Don't top land behind the rising ground to the west, due to rotor. 
Bottom 
Landing 
The bottom landing field A slopes and can be difficult to get into on a modem 
hang glider. 
Beware of the power lines. 
Paragliders can side land anywhere but ensure you have an into-wind beat and 
watch out for badger sets etc. The bottom landing is directly out in front of 
launch for paragliders. 
Special 
Rules 
This site is normally closed for three days every fortnight during the pheasantshooting season (end October to end February). Dates are published in the 
Wessex Club newsletter and on the club website. 
Do not climb on the dry stone wall. Only cross at the stile behind take-off. 
Do not over fly or top land in fields A and B when there are sheep in them. 
Avoid flying over Smedmore House (see map) as the occupants are sensitive 
about their privacy. 
Ridge Runs, 
XC 
This site can be very thermic but, being close to the sea, height gains of more 
than 1,000ft ATO are uncommon. It is possible to drop onto the Purbeck Hills 
and run down to Swanage or from the Purbeck Ridge drop back toward 
Studland. Be aware of Poole Harbour and Bournemouth ATZ.  
From Swyre Head it is possible to fly out onto the sea cliffs and west toward 
the tower or east onto St. Aldhelmâ€™s Head. Both these adventures are quite 
technical and should not be undertaken without some thought. Bottom landing 
beneath the cliffs is very limited and changes in cliff angle along many 
stretches of the cliff will produce areas of sink. 
Flying 
Generally 
Despite the size of this site, it can become busy especially on light wind days 
when separation is poor. Some pleasant evenings can also be had on this site 
during the summer and sea breeze works well here. On rough days it can be a 
good place to practice active flying.

name: Corton Denham LZ
desc:
Flying 
Generally 
The site is rarely visited by Wessex members but might be worth a visit to test 
that XC potential.  
There is also a ridge run of a mile or so in a southerly direction, height gains 
are usually limited so a thermic day may assist. The site can suffer from 
turbulence.

name: Model Ridge LZ
desc: top landing no problem

name: cringle moor LZ
desc: landing at model no problem

name: Bank Hill LZ
desc: Within the grounds of Dollar Academy you are on private grounds; please be courteous and respectful.

name: Vault Bay LZ
desc:
Top Landing Notes: Try to avoid Landing outsite the designated areas.  DO NOT land in any field where livestock may be disturbed. Beware of rotor downwind of hedges and wind shear where fields slope away downwind.


Bottom Landing Notes: The beach can be narrow and a cross wind landing will be required. The carry up is long and steep.

name: St. Agnes LZ
desc:
Bottom Landing Notes: Not at all applicable, sea â€“ never any beach!

Top Landing Notes: Land in the huge area behind and to the west of launch. Land well back. Do not overshoot.

name: Carn Liath LZ
desc: By the cars

name: Bodesbeck Law LZ
desc: It is best to top land or slope land quite high up the hill. The hill is rather steep and scree slope is not ideal for climbing with a bundled glider! Bottom Landing is possible but it's a 30km walk back to the car via the roads so not recommended unless a car has been left in an appropriate place.

name: Pilgrims Farm LZ
desc:
Top slope and bottom landing all available, be aware there are sometimes cattle in the bottom landing field and also there are thin electric wire fences in the lower field.

Be careful with the trees and the obvious turbulence they can cause.

Also if top landing again be aware of the Public footpath along the tree line. The public do like to sit down and watch. Please be courteous.

name: Sticks Bowl LZ
desc:
Bottom top or slope landing all possible.

Be aware of hazards in the landing area, such as rabbit holes and the obvious fence line running left to right in front of take off.

Land anywhere out to the front, top land or slope land

name: Tinto (alternative N'ly t/o) LZ
desc: Anywhere

name: Buckies landing
desc: Fields South of Easter Glinns Farm. Please do not over-fly the farm to land near the cars

name: Rustavi LZ
desc: You can land absolutely everywhere. Great for beginners.

name: Tbilisi Sea LZ
desc: very easy, broad field

name: Jijeti LZ
desc: Fairly broad fields for landing, so unless you fool around, you will not have any problems.

name: Tkhibuli Crater LZ
desc: One relatively small landing site, exposed to winds and thermals. Challenging to get into.

name: Kazbegi LZ
desc: 1800 ASL under takeoff.

name: Gudauri (skyatlantida.com) LZ
desc:
landing in the valleys on specially prepared land.
More write, we answer on our site.

name: St Hilaire du Rorota LZ
desc: 0 m, on the beach

name: Nkawkaw LZ
desc: Soccer field, Its easy to find a Taxi from here back up to Launch, or to walk to Rojo Hotel accross the road for a swim :)

name: Osuduku LZ
desc: Many open areas available, varies depending on wind direction.

name: Nuuk Area LZ
desc:
Aallartarfik 1,
Aallartarfik 2,
Qinngorput,
Quassussuaq,
Qernertunnguit,
Innannguit,
Tuapannguit,

name: Maligiaq LZ
desc:
Landing normaly by camp site:
66 57' 49' N - 52 34' 54'
Lots of safe space for beginners to land on

name: Gangan Kiria LZ
desc:
Many choices:
* Top: 50m from village. 
* Several ledges on way down.
* Many open spaces at base of hill.

name: Omblos (Patras) LZ
desc: Difficult for club pilots -IPPI 3 who need instruction.

name: Kithenonas LZ
desc: Many landing zones, some are rocky or cultured land.

name: Toksotes LZ
desc:
Main landing field near asphalt road to the take off 
Second landing by the river sand very good ONLY EARLY MORNING AND LATE AFTERNOON avoid it during midday due to the strong valley winds

name: Korilovos South
desc: Demanding small field near asphalt road in that case there are alternative landing fileds on the east side of the hill

name: Pirgi-Petrousa LZ
desc: Easy Fields near village Petrousa big landing field

name: Stranoma - Thermo LZ
desc: At the valley below.

name: Kontogialos LZ
desc: On the beach - toplanding is demanding

name: mirtiotisa LZ
desc: to the glyfada  beach

name: troumpetas LZ
desc: near village  doukades

name: agios gordis LZ
desc: to the beach : not so much space...

name: Embesos LZ
desc: Inahos municipality bought a large field exclusively for landing area

name: pantokratoras LZ
desc: at barbati beach

name: Uruguai LZ
desc: snow

name: Psiloritis-Akolita LZ
desc: Southern Shore

name: falasarna LZ
desc: every where in the big beach,usually between 2 beach bars.

name: Vlaherna - Agrinion LZ
desc: At fields west of take off or top landing.

name: Petrohori LZ
desc: Top landing or at the beach of Trichonida lake under take off.

name: Palaiokaria LZ
desc: Beware if the landing fields have crop. Owners not specially friendly.

name: Retsina LZ
desc: Landing with 'closed eyes'

name: Kathisma LZ
desc: At the beautiful beach, near to your umbrella...

name: Menidi LZ
desc: A triangle open area, used as a car parking of swimmers during summer.

name: Varasova LZ
desc: Easy at fields under take off

name: Paravola LZ
desc: at the field next to school

name: Ypato LZ
desc: Relatively easy once you fly over the wires

name: Kalenji LZ
desc: Kalenji-Erimantia

name: landing
desc: landing on the beach

name: Kofinas Amfissas LZ
desc:
There are (at least) two landings. One at the base of the hill (not for beginnners) and one across the main road in the big industrial area.

There are electricity cables and high voltage pylons around which are not dangerous as long as you notice where they are and keep them in mind.

name: Gkrika -  Ai Lias LZ
desc: easy

name: Neohori Trikalon
desc: grassy landing

name: Panagia-Kefalari LZ
desc:
Large fields near the village of Kefalari 
PLEASE AVOID THE CULTIVATED FIELDS 
Power lines are clearly visible

name: asiderotas LZ
desc: very eazy, at the beach

name: Korilovos East
desc:
Easy Landing 
Large fields on the east side of the hill

name: Flying Paradise Tin Tin LZ
desc: Landing on a private place. Landing at the beach is prohibited!!!

name: Ellinopirgos LZ
desc: very easy. big grassy area without lines or buildings.

name: Mouzaki LZ
desc: 50x100m but not suitable for begginers. alternative landing spots available and suitables for begginers.

name: Exanthia LZ
desc: Kathisma Beach

name: Exanthia, Lefkada LZ
desc: Kathisma Beach

name: Plaka LZ
desc:
A little bit inclined downhill both left and right of the corral.

Maybe innapropriate for inexperienced hangglider pilots

name: Kato Vasiliki LZ
desc: Numerous fields right below the site, or a beach during strong thermal conditions

name: Kamvounia Mt
desc: Grassy landing

name: Kamvounia Mt NW
desc: grassy landing

name: Aphrodite LZ
desc: Large Landing Field, be aware of turbulences due to south-wind

name: Leptokaryá LZ
desc: See picture, field with large stones on the opposite side of the valley. Please check for Obstacles prior takeoff!

name: Panajachel LZ
desc: In the dry riverbed or at the hotel close to the entrance to town.

name: Ma On Shan LZ
desc:
Again please refer to:

http://www.hkpa.net/index.php/home/flying-information/site-guide/east-winds/ma-on-shan

Top landing is generally quite easy here. Never approach further back than the trees behind takeoff. Beware of hikers, dogs, cows and other pilots during landing!

For landing below, it is essential to read the description in the link above.

name: Pak Tam Au LZ
desc: Lower hill Ngam Tau Shan or Shek Keng; top landing.

name: Shek-O (Dragon's Back) LZ
desc:
Rocky Bay Beach between golfcourse and Shek-O main beach. Requires inspection before your first landing. Take the path between the Shek O bus stop (there is only one) and the golf course. You'll walk past a basketball court to get there. If you end up at Ben's Backstreet Surf Bar (good place for after-flight drinks!) you are on the right beach, but landing area is at north end of this beach. 

Landing on the Shek O main beach or on the golf course is PROHIBITED unless it's an emergency situation. 

Again - *mandatory* - see the excellent photos, videos and site briefing at: http://hkpa.net/index.php/main-menu/flying-information/site-guide?id=39

name: yuscaran LZ
desc: Normal landing field is El Llano, about 4kms by road South East of Yuscaran and also 4.5 kms flight path from launch.  Bailout in the footbal grounds is allways an easy glide from launch.

name: Isla de la Tigre LZ
desc: Playa del Burro/ Donkey Beach when the tide is out, several other options can be seen from launch

name: Azacualpa LZ
desc:
1;Top landing, huge fields behind launch for easy top landing.
2;A road passes 250 meters below launch to a bailout field for those that don't wish to retrieve from the valley- a long drive....
3; 1,000 meters below launch is Piedra Blanca with various landing choices, the North South running valley offers landing in both directions for cross country flights.

name: Danli, Bella Vista LZ
desc: Abundant landing opportunities from immediately below launch and all over the wide valley extending south to El Paraiso 15kms away.

name: la Villa de San Fransisco LZ
desc: Huge agricultural valley with ample landing choices. Pay attention enroute to power lines etc. especially in fields close to town. Don't land in growing crops and avoid sugar cane fields, the leaves are sharp!

name: Japetic LZ
desc:
east of the Sveta Jana village, SE of the the graveyard :)
take a look at site webpage, there is a picture of it (http://www.parafreek.hr/novi/index.php?option=com_content&task=blogcategory&id=23&Itemid=43)
it is marked as GLAVNO SLETISTE

name: Buzet - Zavoj LZ
desc: Meadow with windsock besides road leading to TOs; it is also possible to outland right in front of TO.

name: Biokovo-Makarska LZ
desc: 1m ASL  at the beach, near town of Makarska

name: Mirkovac LZ
desc: Agrofild near road, or small Agrocultuar airport.

name: Osijek - Cepin LZ
desc: sport airport and everywhere

name: Tribalj (Rijeka) LZ
desc: You can use two places for landing, one is lawn in the center of Tribalj, near the football grounds, and the other is a spacious lawn west of the lake in Tribalj, next to a pine forest along the road. Space for landing is more than enough, but still you should pay attention to wires near lake that goes along the edge and through the valley. During the thermally active day landing in central Tribalj will pose a problem due to turbulence created by the houses and thermals, and the lawn is splitted by fence in the middle.

name: Grobnik LZ
desc:
Landing is at 310 m ASL airfield.

Nearest alternative anding is shooting range below Zbelac, but should be avoided because it is in military jurisdiction.

name: Baska (Krk) LZ
desc: Beach

name: Hum Komiza LZ
desc: Fields near road over the city, or port of Komiza

name: Greda (Split) LZ
desc:
N 43 47 21 E 016 40 02
elevation: ASL 520m
or anywhere in nearby fields

name: Buzet - da Nevio LZ
desc: TOP-landing not really recommended: the rotor reaches quite far back and the nice looking meadows are full of sharp stones...

name: Sky Baranda places LZ
desc: Near fild

name: Samatovci Luftwaffe plac LZ
desc: Everywhere in fild around .

name: Kastelir LZ

name: Vrgorac LZ
desc: Field near the willage Kotezi , suitable for begginers

name: Nagy-Eged LZ
desc: Two huge landing areas, easy to reach.

name: Kartal LZ
desc: Landing in field

name: Kalocsa LZ
desc: plenty of space

name: Gödöllői reptér - Gödöllő airport LZ
desc: Landing in airfield

desc: Little bit tricky. Check the landing area first!

desc: Power lines!

name: Mount Puncak (Gunung Mas Puncak) LZ
desc: Landing area is about 1 km from take off area, this landing area still located at tea plantation area.

name: Bukit Langkisau LZ
desc: Salido beach

name: Timbis Bukit LZ
desc: Large Beach area to land or top landing is relatively easy as well.

name: Mount Banyak (Gunung Banyak) LZ
desc: Landing area is 950m and in size of a soccer field, 1km away from take-off area. There is a guest house and a shelter for the pilots.

name: Singkarak LZ
desc: Some dry rice fields northeast of the takeoff

name: Maninjau LZ
desc:
A former rice field close to the lake. 

In the late afternoon the wind from the lake can get quite strong. Don't approach to low.

name: Wonogiri LZ
desc: In big football field by the lake. Lot of space to set up for landing.

name: Gedongsongo LZ
desc: very wide grass field. parking car available

name: Meteseh LZ
desc: very wide grass field

name: Candi Dasa (Bali) LZ
desc:
An easy landing is anywhere on the very long black beach in front of take-off.  Very safe...but it's a longish motorbike ride back to take-off.  Expect to pay around $5 (negotiable) for a ride back to take-off or Candi Dasa.

A more convenient landing is on any of the smaller white beaches in front of the hotels in Candi Dasa.  The end beach at the East end, in front of Puri Bagus hotel is the largest and the closest to the start of the take-off walk up...where you have probably left your scooter.  It's no more than a 5 minute walk.  The beaches look small from the air but are really big and quite safe.  Maybe a good idea to put your own windsock or ribbon on a stick before going to take-off.

name: Taeh Bukit LZ
desc: Landing Area is about 1,8 km from Take off. Landing in big grass field. Lot of space to set up for landing.

name: Lapale LZ
desc: Bidadari lake

name: Sorrel Hill LZ
desc: anywhere,

name: Rosbeigh LZ
desc: In the football field, East of the road that goes behind the beach.  No obstructions for 1km, except the childrens playground near the road.

name: Lough Bray LZ
desc:
You can land at the bottom of the hill 
53.189226,-6.300016
 or close to the R115 road after you finish flying.

name: Monavullagh LZ
desc: Lots of space to land on the valley floor. Easy to find.

name: The Vee LZ
desc: Landing is not so great here. Although there are plenty of flat fields on the flatlands north of the mountain, there are a lot of grumpy landowners around. There is a walking trail that goes all the way up the mountain. It is clearly visible from the air. The walking trail is a public thoroughfare and you can legally land on it. The part of the walking trail at the bottom and east side of the mountain is wide enough to make a good landing approach and safe landing, but do keep an eye out for walkers! Landings can also be accomplished on the mountain near the 'hairpin' bend on the road (also clearly visible from the air) but it requires a skilled pilot.

name: Knockanaffrin LZ
desc: Several. Easy to find.

name: Bray Head LZ
desc: at the takeoff spot or at the nearby beach

name: Minaun, Achill Island LZ
desc: beach below or when SW - boggy fields nearby

name: Seefin NE (Co.Kerry) LZ
desc:
Best option is to top land. There are no obstructions on top. And the landing area is large.  The top landing is very easy for HG's.
Otherwise land across the river at the bottom of the hill, but please note that these fields are usually quite wet.
Also beware the almost invisible wires near some of the bottom fields.

name: Trawalua Strand LZ
desc: beach

name: Clara LZ
desc:
Landing in small fields below the hill, north or west of the road, as the fields between the road and the mountain are quite steep.

*Please note that there will always be telephone wires beside the roads.

**Please take care not to land in fields near to Horses or cattle.

name: Gneeves NE LZ
desc:
Top landing is a good option, but in front of the wind turbines please.
The ground at the bottom is quite rough.
Top landing in the rough area of the fallen trees is not advised.

Bottom landing beside the road up to the site, although be careful of wire fences across the fields.

name: Mweelin LZ
desc:
Top landings usually.  The top area, especially when flown in a southerly/southeasterly has a large flat bog behind the site, and if you cant land a HG. there then you probably shouldn't be flying.
At the bottom we usually use the long field between the farm buildings and the hill, but it is not flat.
Further out in front we land near the grey shed at the road junction 2km from the top.
Beware of wires in the fields around the bottom.

name: Dingle Bowl LZ
desc:
Top landing usually.  Plenty flat area on top behind the take off area.

Also PG's use a bottom landing field near the large round sewage storage containers 3km south of the site.

name: Caherdaniel - Cahernageeha Mtn. LZ
desc:
Top landing is best.
Bottom landings are in small sloping fields.

name: Ballaghasheen Gap LZ
desc: Land beside the road 1km down the valley, where there Electricity line turns up the valley.

name: Musheramore (W) LZ
desc:
Bottom landing anywhere to the south of Parking area.  No obstacles.
Top landing is very possible too

name: Mt.Gabriel LZ
desc:
There are no special landing fields
Find the biggest safest ones.
Beware overhead wires in the landing fields.

name: Dunworly Bay LZ
desc:
There is no good bottom landing area anywhere here.
Do not Land in the water.
You must top be able to top land behind the take off.
Many top landing options here...
Slope landing is a poor option.

name: Old Head of Kinsale (Cork) LZ
desc:
The normal landing area is behind (east) of the take off area, across the road.
otherwise you can slope land.

There is absolutely no bottom landing.

Please do not to land on the Golf Course.
This is private land and to leave you will have to pay 'Green Fees'...
(thats over â‚¬200 per each time)

name: Maumturk Mts LZ
desc: Beside car park. ATTENTION- BE ALERT!!!! power lines just near the road and car park- please watch out!.

name: Croaghmoyle LZ
desc:
On the grassy field bellow.
Top landing available on flat spot behind take-off.

name: Gleninagh Mt. LZ
desc: Plenty of fields bellow massive- alternate top landing available.

name: Arra LZ
desc: Plenty of fields bellow mount or Top landing near take-off place

name: Mushera (N) LZ
desc:
There is no dedicated landing area here.
Normally we land is east of the Car Park. Or else land anywhere down the valley.
Even in high winds it is safe to behind the car park as there are no obstructions.

name: Loughcrillan RTE Transmitter LZ
desc: Landing is parallel to the main road N56 to Portnoo and Naran.I have landed in some flat fields without obstructions.

name: Sky Road LZ
desc: Top landing near take-off. Eventually down the slope.

name: Ballyelly LZ
desc: Beside car park.

name: Silver Strand LZ
desc: Any safe designed by you. Mostly recommended is top landing- watch for the rotor in the case of strong wind speed. Alternate- you can land on the beach- if the tide is off of- course!. Other spots you can find on N-W or N-E of the cliff. Good luck!

name: Abbey Hill LZ
desc: On the grassy field below hill. Alternate top landing.

name: Inch Beach - This site is currently CLOSED to all Flying LZ
desc: Top Land on launch or behind.

name: Knocknakilton LZ
desc: land near the junction with the public road at the bottom

name: Glengarriff LZ
desc: Top Landing is best as the bottom is full of trees.

name: Gneeves (E) LZ
desc:
Top landing area behind the site....
or land by the public road to the north
or land out in front.

name: Knocknakilla    -   NW-N LZ
desc: Safe Landing area near the Knocknakilla standing stones to the left of take off (200m west), or bottom land in the field below the take off (but it is a good walk back up)

name: Croagh Patrick East Site LZ
desc: At the field of Famine Monument or the field on the west of Famine monument. Do not land on field near Famine monument on the east- owner doesn't like it!

name: Ben Goram LZ
desc: West of car park

name: Silvermine Mts. LZ
desc: Near silver mine

name: Slivecarran LZ
desc: Fields bellow

name: Slievecarran North LZ
desc: Plenty of fields below

name: Gleninagh Mt. lower launch LZ
desc: Bellow of the launch on the grassy field- alternate top landing on safe flat spots.

name: Shannakeela Mt. LZ
desc: Any fields bellow.

name: Redeemed Siner LZ
desc: Any safe fields bellow the mount.

name: Gleninagh North LZ
desc: Field bellow

name: Breanlee (Hydro Road) LZ
desc: Try not to land low down the valley as there are loads of rocks.  Much safer to land just at the bottom of the r idge and then walk back down the 200m

name: Gap of Dunloe LZ
desc:
There are plenty of flat fields below the take off area to land in.
Perhaps the most accessible on is at the cross road to the north.

name: Gougane Barra LZ
desc: Best landing areas are between the church and all the trees..... it is rough ground but generally fine for landing in.

name: Skellig Michael LZ
desc:
Only TOP landing...on CHRIST's SEAT where you launched from. 
AND you have to be a really great pilot to land back down here. It is narrow, short and very steep on both sides.

The bottom landing is in the ocean.
DANGER OF DEATH/DROWNING
(do not attempt this!)

Do not attempt a slope landing.
Do not hope for a bottom landing.
Make sure that you have your own water rescue support boat waiting in case you go down, or get blown over the back.

name: Parkana LZ
desc:
Top landing is big, flat and dry.
Bottom landing is HUGE, a bit wet underfoot and a good hike back up to the road.

name: Madman's Seat LZ
desc:
There are NO designated bottom landing fields, to date. Please be considerate to landowners, crops and animals if you are landing in the valley.

Top landing is clear near where you park the car, but beware of much stronger winds up the middle of the Gap of Dunloe.

name: Minister's Fall (Tomies Wood) LZ
desc:
Top landing is the only one possible unless you do an XC.
the landing area shown is where to leave your car.  The fields around here are flat, but have power lines in them.

If wind increases then fly south along the edge of the lake and land near a place that is locally known as the 'Meeting of the Waters'
Dinish Cottage is close to here.

It is also possible to land in the bowl of the big mountains behind.

name: Triskbeg (Kerry Head) LZ
desc:
Land near the village, or back on top (best option).
very few trees on kerry head.

name: Kerry Head (West) LZ
desc:
Top landing ONLY.
Landing down will be in the sea.

name: Kerry Head (NW-N) LZ
desc:
Top landing ONLY. 
Landing down will be in the sea.

name: Kerry Head (Northeast) LZ
desc:
Top landing ONLY. 
Landing down will be in the sea.

name: Ballyheigue LZ
desc:
land where you take off.
bottom landing is in the sea, unless the water (tide) is out

name: Mweelin N-E LZ
desc:
Either top land or land in the large flat field at the bottom of the site.

Lots of space for top landings here.

name: Sillaherdane LZ
desc:
There is a good field a little out from the bottom of the site, alongside the road.

just be careful for overhead wires near the road.

name: Knockboy (Caoinkeen) LZ
desc: Land out at the mouth of the bowl , where the road is nearby... there are some flat areas here suitable for landing.... otherwise flydown to the bottom of the valley and land there (but remember it is a bit wet down by the river there)....and a good walk back up to the road.

name: Priest's Leap LZ
desc: some top landing options available, otherwise somewhere down the valley

name: Caum LZ
desc: top land or find a suitable landing area at the bottom between the road and the lake.

name: Stookeen LZ
desc:
Land anywhere NORTH of the road below the hill..

DO NOT LAND between the lake and the road... The local farmer is very sensitive against anyone being on his land ... and he gets very upset

name: Top of Bealach (Millstreet) LZ
desc:
the largest landing field below the hill is used for landing.
The farmers around here are quite friendly.

name: Rossacroo LZ
desc: best to land near north of the hill and close to the road.

name: The Paps LZ
desc:
The landing area shown is for flying on the north side of the mountain only.

do not try to land on the road above the lake as the wind here is usually quite strong...and there are lots of trees around.

name: The Paps (Southwest site) LZ
desc:
Landing is near the road in the valley below.
You can top land with ease, but you still have to go down to get to your car.

name: Knocknabro LZ
desc:
land north of the Lake.
The landing shown is for flying on the Northwest side only.
Landing for the southerly launches is at the bottom of the Clydagh Valley.

name: Knocknagowan LZ
desc: anywhere down in the Clydagh Valley.

name: Killeen LZ
desc: Land in the falley bottom but be careful with overhead power lines.

name: Coolcurtoga LZ
desc:
Land in the valley to the west, beside the road.
beware of the many overhead wires in the valley.

name: Crohane LZ
desc:
The landing shown is for flying on the north side of the mountain.
The local farmer who owns the field is very friendly.  He lives in the cottage beside this field.

name: Torc LZ
desc: Landing is in the Fields between the Hill and Muckross House.

name: Rosbeigh Dunes LZ
desc: Land on the beach

name: Bentee LZ
desc: DO NOT land in the town as there are many overhead power lines

name: Aghatubride LZ
desc: There are plenty safe landing fields on all sides of the mountain.

name: Knockavahaun LZ
desc:
Plenty safe landing fields on all sides of the mountain... choose a big one.
The Landing area shown has high power cables overhead

name: Coomduff LZ
desc: Best place is down near Coomduff Cross roads

name: Kilkeaveragh LZ
desc: Top landing is possible, but beware of ground support wires for the transmitters.

name: Coonanaspig LZ
desc: Top Landing only

name: Foilnageragh LZ
desc:
Land back on top.
There is No bottom landing.

name: Connor Pass LZ
desc: top land at the car park if the wind is not too strong... otherwise land in the valley below.

name: Croagh Sceirde LZ
desc:
Top Landing...fly over the back and land by the track that  you walked up to get here.
Bottom landing in the largest field you can find near the main road.

name: The Hags' Teeth LZ
desc:
Be careful landing below the hill as the ground very rough with hidden rocks and holes.
Also, many power lines in the small fields.

name: The Windy Gap LZ
desc:
Anywhere suitable on the valley floor.

We fly both sides of the hill, but only the southeast landing area is shown.

name: BallyMac.@Seven Heads Bay LZ
desc:
TOP LANDING ONLY....
Land behind where you take off.
The terrain is flat.
Beware of electricity wires & Poles

name: Coolim Cliffs @ Seven HEads Bay LZ
desc: Top landing only.

name: Shehy Mtn LZ
desc:
Limited landing places below are limited due to trees, lakes and big rocks.
Options good flo top/slope landing
or XC 4km west to flat farmland

Note: The landing area shown is the location of car park.

name: Arroo LZ
desc: top landing

name: Leenaun LZ
desc:
Landing and car-park facility (2 Cars only) at 
53.587883, -9.689952

name: Netanya (Natanya) LZ
desc: ridge - about 40 meters

name: Mevo Hama LZ
desc: XC or right down

name: Mahstesh Ha-Gadol LZ
desc: big field near the car parking

name: Muhraka LZ
desc: under the take off on the free field near the road number 70 to Haifa. Look out for the power line.

name: Sharona LZ
desc: On the free not planted field under the take off. Landing field has a slope. Possible top landing on take off or on field to the right

name: Yavneel LZ
desc: on village field under take off. There is big field  but field surrounded from all sides, be careful and loose enough high.

name: Har Hari LZ
desc:
On the big field near Rama village. To the right from big antenna.
Check the landing field before for some barriers of farmers.

name: Gilboa Mount Shaul LZ
desc: On the road between the farmed field

name: Camun LZ
desc: from right side - southerner of the take off. two big field parallel to the road. Can't see the landing place from the take off.

name: Top landing area
desc: Good top landing for PG and HG next to parking.

name: Slieau Ruy midpoint landing area
desc: Big and flat

name: Tholtywill landing area
desc: Big flat landing area. Landings can slo be made alongside the road if caught short.

name: Tower Hill (Kamshet) LZ
desc:
Good landing area.
240mt below Launch.

name: Billing - Bir LZ
desc: sunset ground is so far claimed as official landing.

name: Arambol LZ
desc: Landing is either back on top or on one of the beaches. If you've had enough and choose a beach its best to land close to a bar. ;)

name: Nandi Hills LZ
desc:
Plenty of open fields all around the hills.However be very careful of power lines & fences. Please do not land in fields with crops. We have designated LZ's which facilitates easy retrieval.
More info on www.flynandi.com

name: Pawna (Pavna) LZ
desc: nice flat grassy lakeside flat with non-jagged rocks intermittently appearing.

name: Rishikesh - Kunjapuri LZ
desc: You can not see the landing from takeoff which is below you to the left of Rishikesh. Main landing just up river of Lakshman Jula in Rishikesh on a sand bank next to the Ganges river. Landing is about 6km from take of and if you catch no lift you may fall short of landing. In this case find any rice field and keep a careful eye for power lines which plague the Indian landscape. These fields can be deceptively small.

name: Yelagiri LZ
desc: Common designated for both NW & SW launch sites. LZ is located by the side of a large pond & very close to the Tourist park.

name: Pavagadh LZ
desc: 240 m ASL

name: Saputara LZ
desc: Landing is in the fields about 400M below the takeoff.

name: Vagamon - Main Ridge LZ
desc: Top-landing is the main option. It is easy as there is plenty of room clear of obstacles. Just make sure you stay away of the areas that might have rotor. Bottom landing is also possible, but landing sites are few and going back up to the take off area is not so easy.

name: Kodungallur PG Site LZ
desc:
Lot of landing options along the beachfront. Wind usually start from east in the morning and turn to blow from SW at 11, then W and from NW after 2 pm. Speed varies from 5kms/hr to 15 kms/hr.  Can fly about 30 kms along the wide beachfront with lot of emergency landing options.
Motorable road upto the landing.

name: Tungareshwar LZ
desc: There are plenty of landing options in gliding distance. You can choose an area close to the road and make your landing approcah.

name: Tokpada LZ
desc: Since it is a huge open flatland one can land anywhere. No obstructions on the field.

name: Agashi Paddy fields LZ
desc: This is a huge open field suitable for ground handling and winching

name: Mount Abu LZ
desc: There are several good LZ below the village is called 'Anadra village' the best place to land is in front of the temple â€œBhairu tarak dham â€œ it is a Jain temple and one can get a nice cup of tea at the nearby local stall.. This side of the mountain is ideal for SW winds which are prevalent from March to October.

name: Arna LZ
desc: open field in front

name: Pushkar LZ
desc: landing on the dunes behind the town for SW and W winds.

name: Bavarli LZ
desc: Vast landing fields all over

name: Visapur LZ
desc: Loads of landing options in the fields below takeoff. Avoid landing too close to the village & in fields with standing crops.

name: Kone LZ
desc: Lots of landing places

name: Saputara Governor Hill LZ
desc: At the large ground, also used as helipad.

name: Roopmati Pavilion LZ
desc: Below in the valley, need to arrange pickup vehicle as there is no local transport available

name: Durtlanang LZ
desc:
Football field.  but small and hill top.
and there are many power lines.
Only for Expert pilots.

name: Panchgani LZ
desc:
TOP-landing can be done with 'mild' winds.
But many incidents/ accidents have happend while pilots attempted to topland in inadequate
conditions!! If in any doubt: land 'below'.

name: Ghayabari Tea Garden, Kurseong LZ
desc:
Rohini - Kurseong

610 mts Asl
26.8502 N; 
88.2944 E

name: Hoskote Lake Bed LZ
desc: Flat dry lake bed.

name: Captain Hill Yadamadu LZ
desc:
East side landing area is limited and is in fields.
West side landing area is huge and is in fields.

name: Raghav Hill LZ
desc: Landing zone is in the fields in front of the hill.

name: panvel uran road LZ
desc: good

name: Saptashrungi LZ
desc: Landing possible all around in the farm fields below.

name: Bandla LZ
desc: landing is in Luhanu ground , this is very big and safe play ground near cricket stadium Bilaspur city.

name: Trimbak Godavari Ridge LZ
desc: Multiple landing options, including top landing(when not much thermic)

name: Zanzroli LZ
desc: In case of top to bottom flights landing are in small zones where on has to use his skills to maneuver the glider with good speed to landing zone. In case of good soaring flights there are multiple choices for landing.

name: Deolai LZ
desc: There are multiple spots suitable for landing at the base of the mountain. Watch out for barbed wire fences.You will need to walk about half to one mile to the landing parking location shown. The walk is through some private agricultural fields. Please be courteous, if you come across some locals and be mindful of their crops/livestock.

name: shah-raan (lower hill) LZ
desc:
just under takoff. it's pilot's appointment in Tehran, and the shuttle's start (paying).
alti: 1567m

name: Rijab LZ
desc:
under the cliff or on the takeoff. If you land under the cliff it's faster to come back by walk.
alti: 666m

name: Kerend LZ
desc:
in the football stadium if you are a good pilot. becarfull of big rotors.
alti: 1539m

name: Taft LZ
desc:
near the river.
alti: 1583m

name: Sadra LZ
desc:
north side: alti: 1785m
south side: big place!

name: Gandilac LZ
desc:
Just near the little village, Gandilac, in the south-east of the takeoff.
alti: 1461m

name: Seyedan LZ
desc:
We landed in the football stadium, but it's not the official landing area. Without dust but with a big closing!
actually local pilots land in a field near the road but be careful of power lines. the filed is big but surrounded by power lines . the height of power lines is about 11 meters above the ground so do not afraid. 
alti: 1646m

name: montain LZ
desc:
on the flat land, you have all the desert.
alti: 1240m

name: Emam Zadeh Hashem (Mosha) LZ
desc: LZ is on south of take off. Coordinate is 35 45 55N - 52 02 06E

name: Abb-E-Sard LZ
desc: Near parking area where ever you can land but not on the farms.

name: shahran (peak) LZ
desc:
***Danger**
Watch out for the power lines before the the landing site.

There's also an oil depot to the the north of landing site.

name: Tochal LZ
desc: The Landing point is not accurate.

name: Turan Kala LZ
desc: Near Caspian sea

name: Surdar LZ
desc:

name: Val della Torre LZ
desc:
Official landing (rented by the community Valdellatorre) is a site on the south side of Mount Rosselli, pretty large field next to the gravel road and right east from the farm under construction, with some trees in the middle. Landing site easily reachable by car. Continue on the road passing by the market and Carrefour shop for approximately 1km.

Unless its an emergency, avoid making top-landing on the Barone ridge (SE from Roselli peak). Despite it looks smooth from above, lots of hidden sharp rocks below a long grass may ruin your day.

P.S. As of November 2011 the stolen windsock is back on landing site again and makes the life easier.
Just case if it is missing again - observe the smoke and other signs in the valley. Normally during the day the wind is from east and just before sunset (1-2hrs) turns from west. If still in doubts, better land towards the west, even with light tailwind, as the field has a slight slope which makes the westward landings shorter.

name: Main LZ
desc: The main landing is located about 200 meters east of the Col Rodella cable car station, there is a wind sock on the west side. The landing is very big and easy, but we must be alert to the power line that crosses this longitudinally to the normal landing path. The secondary landing just across the river at the beginning of the town of Canazei. The windsock is located more or less at the center of the landing and this is equally easy. For both landings normally landing direction is from west to east in the morning; afternoon: normally east to west, In case of stronger (west) winds: pay attention to the trees situated at beginning of the landings, which could create rotors.

name: Suello
desc:
Landing Suello: big sized field next to the restaurant (Cielo e Terra) (N45.81750, E9.31853, 260m). It is the principal landing of this location where shuttles are available every flyable day. Very easy to land for paragliding pilot of every level. Not so easy for hangliders beginner because it is a light slope.


Landing 'Palude', in Cesana Brianza, near Pusiano Lake and in front of Centrale take off, a big field with high voltage lines crossing the east side of the landing, perfect for hang gliding.

name: Loggia di Pilato - Monopoli LZ
desc:
Landing is sufficiently long but not extremely wide; it works fine when marine breeze directs the wind to blow parallel to the longer dimension. Pay attention to few trees on the field. The field is not on a plan but relatively steep and thermal flows generate from there usually, so it is recommended to decrease height while on the top portion of the field itself. Wind is not indicated with wind sleeves but with some strings of fabric which are positioned on top of a tree which is on the center/right part of the landing field (seen from the cliff).

NOTE: This site is currently managed by paragliding association 'Club VOLARIA' based on a rental contract for the takeoff and landing locations and in agreement with the local department of WWF. Please contact the club if you want to access the flying zone

Also, pay attention to learners of local school 'Aero Club Fly Way' who practice in this field (mainly march to october)

desc:

PG: near gondola station. ONLY Oct-Mar!!! Be careful, this landing has got a significant slope, and on the field at some places there are approx 1m high wood poles stuck in the soil vertically. It is highly recommended to visit the field before landing there.

Beware the wind direction at the landing sometimes shifts rapidly by 180 degrees. Normally the valley breeze is coming from west, but at some specific conditions the valley breeze from Locarno may enter as far as the landing site.

name: Campitello-Canazei-Belvedere LZ
desc:
There is no landings near the start of the Belvedere cable car, you should use those Campitello. We recommend using the secondary landing.
The main landing is located about 200 meters east of the Col Rodella cable car station, there is a wind sock on the west side. The landing is very big and easy, but we must be alert to the power line that crosses this longitudinally to the normal landing path. The secondary landing just across the river at the beginning of the town of Canazei. The windsock is located more or less at the center of the landing and this is equally easy. For both landings normally there is a landing direction from west to east during the morning, increasing in the afternoon breeze starts to land from east to west, in that case pay attention to the trees situated at beginning of the landings, which could create rotors in case of strong breeze.

desc: The official landing is near the river source of Capodifiume, a water park with free entrance where you can also spend pleasant moments of leisure for children, for families or in hot periods to bathe in cold spring water among the ruins of what were once Roman baths. The problem of landing at Capaccio and still of relative importance since the takeoff dominates the whole boundless plain of the Sele which has fields and free spaces as far as the eye can see. The landing by the wind sock at the restaurant is very small. Better go for one of the big fields close by.

name: Maso Tais LZ

The main landing site is at the Side of the road from Siror to Tonadico. There is a large flat area. The windsock is in the center of the landing site. It is important to land only areas where the grass has been cut already, Otherwise some farmer might run after you with the pitchfork!!!!!

name: Monte S. Giorgio - Piossasco LZ
desc:
There are 2 landing sites. The marker on the map indicates the principal landing site which is also suitable for hang gliders. Shuttle bus departs from this landing at weekends. Do not leave your car there if nobody remains on the landing site, car break-ins and theft has happened several times.
Teh other landing is here: 44.979950, 7.447859, and it is mostly used by PG pilots. It is OK to leave the car on the street at this landing.
If not flying XC, please use only the official landing sites.

desc: It is a Big flat area, located on North-West of the town (San Martino di Castrozza). Normally the valley breeze come from South East during the day but in the evening when the sun sets the wind could be from North. Be carefull because near it there is a helicopter landing area so just in case you hear it or see it, the good area to land is in some grass area located on South east of the San Martino di Castrozza. About the wind, keep on your mind the same rules like for the main landing area.

The landing is very big and easy, but we must be alert to the power line that crosses this longitudinally to the normal landing path. The secondary landing just across the river at the beginning of the town of Canazei. The windsock is located more or less at the center of the landing and this is equally easy. For both landings normally there is a landing direction from west to east during the morning, increasing in the afternoon breeze starts to land from east to west, in that case pay attention to the trees situated at beginning of the landings, which could create rotors in case of strong breeze.

name: Chianocco LZ
desc:
On the field next to the a logistic center (with camyons parked inside).
Despite the field is an official landing, some part of it may be cultivated.
Avoid a small wirefence in the middle of field. It is highly reccomneded to check the landing site before the flight(s).

name: Corio LZ
desc:
Coordinates: N45.311019 E7.541952
Altitude: 550 m

Normally the landing direction is southeastward (due to prevailing eastern breeze winds in summer season). Please note that the landing field has got a slight down-slope towards southeast and phone line at the end, so never try to land long. The best if you enter the field already at low altitude from the west corner. Its much better there. The north corner may surprise with rather strong ascending or descending streams and make you land too short or too long.

Please beware of high-tension power lines further west of the landing field.

name: Monte Tenchia LZ
desc: Upon entering the town of Cercivento follow signs for aviation area. Next to sports field

name: Monte Paularo LZ
desc: To the south of the country Paularo. Near the sports ground

name: Rosbella (Boves) LZ
desc: Boves

name: Tocco Da Casauria LZ
desc:
Tocco da Casauria

Large open farmers field.

name: Rocca Calascio Panettone LZ
desc: Be careful of the powerlines running along the road next to the landing field.

name: Rueglio LZ
desc:
There are no official landings in Rueglio however many fields around the village are big and very suitable.
Avoid landing in long grass, cultivated fields or on livestock to avoid confrontation with landowners, otherwise usually they have nothing against paraglider pilots.

Cavallaria and S.Elisabetta landing sites are within a reach of short XC flight. Cavallaria is just 7km away.

name: Moncuni LZ
desc:
Fields below, southwest from Moncuni hill top, behind the road.

Do not land on cultivated land, long grass or fields with livestock.

Beware of some cables and low voltage power lines crossing the fields.

name: Monte Fallito LZ
desc: easy landing

name: Trucetti-Giaveno LZ
desc:
2 landings within a reach of glide:

1) Avigliana landing 
Coordinates: N45.08833 E7.37278
Elevation: 318m ASL
Partially visible from takeoff.
Pretty long field adjacent to 3 separate houses and a street at the end of it.
You can download a Google Earth file from the folowing link:
http://www.velumvolitans.org/images/AtterraggioAvigliana.zip

2) Giaveno landing.
Coordinates: N45.06183, E7.349735
Not visible from takeoff. Located next to the road leading up from Giaveno to takeoff site.
It is quite technical landing site, hence it is highly recommended to check it out before actually going to the takeoff site.

name: Ciavanis-Chialamberto LZ
desc:
Rather big field right west from the village of Chialamberto (800m west from center of the town).
It is opposite side of the river from the main road, accessible by a small bridge.
Field has little slope and power line over the southern part of it. Park the car at skilift parking just 50m away.
Field length >100m, width 60m.

name: Monte Soglio LZ
desc: The same as Corio flying site. check out Corio page for more info.

name: Monte Musinè LZ
desc:
Fields around.
No info on official landing sites (info to be updated as soon as some info is available).
Avoid landings on cultivated land or with livestock. Be polite if it happens to face the landowner.

The marker on the map serves for altitude reference and does not represent an official landing site however the identified field is one of the most reasonable candidates where to land. Please check it before going up to avoid surprises. After taking off you must fly to the east around the ridge, then over church and then to the landing site.

name: Campotenese LZ
desc:
NW anywhere, no restriction.
SE close to a big fountain beside a crossroad.

name: Belvedere Marittimo LZ
desc: Very difficoult, only for experienced pilots.

name: Col di Tenda LZ
desc:
normaly top landing,
landing in the valley on the south side can be tricky due to strong/ turbulent valley winds!

NO offical LZ's available!

name: Colle di Fenestrelle LZ
desc:
Any suitable place on the plain.

Avoid landing close to the livestock.

Please consider that landing is in the park territory, and only Peter Pan flying school has a official agreement to use the main plain for landing. Forest rangers may want to verify this. In any case you can land any time little bit lower at landing site of Pian dell' Alpe.
In low season usually landing on plain is not a problem.

name: La Riposa LZ
desc:
The same as Ciamberlando.

The Chianocco landing is also within a reach of glide.

name: Bolognetta LZ
desc: MANY PLACES TO LAND

name: Praille LZ
desc:
Fields down in the central valley (between Nus and Fenis, be aware of high voltage power lines).
Good suggestions:
1) Chatelair airfield when they are not using it (verify before at Aeroclub).
2) Big field next to the Fenis castle. It is occasionally used as hot air balloon takeoff or landing field. -> Please DO NOT use this landing. The owner does not appreciate it at all.

WARNING: almost any green and smooth looking field in Aosta valley has got the watering system installed with dozens of sprayheads erected on 1-3m high metal poles. Make sure you see them where you plan to land. Best is to check the candidate landing site(s) before.

name: Creto LZ
desc: top landing possible

name: Rignano Garganico LZ
desc: Easy, very large space

name: Alpe  Bill (Macugnaga) LZ
desc:
Name: Miger

How to get there:
At a fraction Pecetto Macugnaga. Large grass beside the road.

features:
Landing very broad, usable in both summer and winter vacations.

notes:
In winter, avoid if possible ruin the trail by walking too much on cross-country skiing.

Obstacles: None

name: Montoso Rucas LZ
desc:
360mt.asl
Big meadow near the street at Bagnolo Piemonte village. No problem.
It could be problems reaching the landing site flying with very old gliders

name: Monte Bue - S.Stefano d' Aveto LZ
Plan-Belle-Crète LZ
desc:
The identified landing field is the official one but not the most easiest or suitable place at all. A good alternative is here:
N45.754368,E7.038577
It is a bog field between the river and railroad, and is completely flat. Pay attention to the water sprayheads on the fields and the fact sometimes the field is used for town's events such as the the cow fights. The best is to check the availability of that field before the flight.

name: Mombarcaro LZ
desc:
Down in the valley to the east. It is the field on the west from the road.
Height 306m.
Strong southern winds can be present on the landing. Check the conditions at landing before taking off.
There is no windsock on the field, but just a streamer located on pole right on the bridge nearby.
TOP-landing also possible.

name: Montefalcone nel Sannio - North LZ
desc:
There is 1 official landing field using by the aeroclub 'I Picchi', the one in the map.
There's also another landing field directly below the takeoff, used only for emergency landing. It's clearly visible from the takeoff, slightly on the left.

name: Landing "Saltnerhütte"
desc: no official landing area - at the valley station there is an absolute ban on land

name: Panni LZ
desc: PossibilitÃ  di top landing, ampi campi di atterraggio su entrambi i lati.

name: Livigno LZ
desc: Everywhere in the valley

name: Monte Vandalino LZ
desc: Fields below in the valley or out on the plains

name: Tremezzo-Crocione-Bellagio LZ
desc:
Nearby Bellagio, so you have to cross the Como lake to get there, but it is possible with a good margin, unless you start low or face a moderate wind.

The long but not so wide grass strip perpendicular to the peninsula. It is said this grass strip was an airport one (for small airplanes of course). 
Usually the landing direction is towards WEST.
Beware of some high trees next to it and a power line crossing it on the western side.

To come back use the ferry from Bellagio to Cadenabbia, Tremezzo or Menaggio.

name: Pian dell' Alpe LZ
desc:
Field below to the right - between the road and the mountain.

Alternatively, you can land on the main plain (see Colle di Fenestrelle).

name: Forte di Fenestrelle LZ
desc: Big field behind the river.

name: Colli di San Fermo (Casazza) LZ
desc:
Toplanding;
altn LZ in Casazza

name: Pila - Plan Praz LZ
desc:
So called 'green area' down in the valley, with the green circles and asphalted running way around it.
Be extremely careful - there is a high tension power line crossing the west fraction of the landing field, and it is pretty high and barely visible from the air. They connect the house south from the field with the power line attached at the motorway.
 Loose your altitude on one of the sides and then enter the field only for the base and final legs. It is suggested to visit the LZ before flying if you fly for the first time. 

Alternatively, there is a nice field just 200m to the west from the official LZ, just next to the house with the hexogonal roof (NE from the big white church). There is also a windsock. It is on private land but its ok to land there. Coordinates: 45.725364,7.286145


In summer (april-august) after the noon this landing may not be usable due to very strong valley breeze.
You must top-land at Plan Praz, but then it is better to take off from Chamole or Couis 1 sites.

GRESSAN 'GREEN AREA' NOT USABLE (ATZ AOSTA, WAITING FOR NOTAM), USE SARRE LANDING 45.712095, 7.251011 (BETTER TAKE OFF CHAMOLE')

name: Pila - Chamole (Aosta) LZ
desc:
1) Plan Praz cableway station (where the Plan Praz takeof is), rather easy top-landing. Use this side when flying in summer and after noon, as the valley breeze down in the valley will be too strong for PG. (> this site is identified by the marker on the map)
2) Gressan 'green area' (see description of Pila - Plan Praz flying site) - in the morning or in autumn, winter, early spring at any time.

3) GRESSAN 'GREEN AREA' NOT USABLE (ATZ AOSTA, WAITING FOR NOTAM), USE SARRE LANDING 45.712095, 7.251011

name: Caseppa LZ
desc: Near Bricco Musso, technical due to obstacles, certainly not for beginners, it is highly recommended to see it before you attempt to fly.

name: Rivalba LZ
desc: Next to the local road. Big field, easy landing.

name: Colliano LZ
desc: Might need to agree with the land owners before starting your climbing to the top. No wind indication, need to be brought by the flying people.

name: Prato Fiorito LZ
desc:
Easy Top landing:
N 44Â° 03.269
E 10Â° 37.223

An emergency landing area available, in private area near Cemetery (red flag on the map)

name: Monte Blum - Clusone LZ
desc:
Not very large but sufficient grass strip next to the sport fields. 
In summer afternoons there may be 15-25kmh of south wind, so loose the altitude above or on the side of the landing.
The landing field is surrounded by corn plantations, if you are not sure to make it to the landing, better land elswhere.

name: Monte Veneretta LZ
desc: Beach at Letojanni, in front of Bar 'Sea Blue'

name: San Giacomo di Andrate LZ
desc:
Borgofranco landing field. > see photo...
The Cavallaria landing is also within the reach if some thermals help and the valley breeze is not too strong.

name: Stribugliano LZ
desc:
Official landing is large almost as an airfield, so there's absolutely no problem. 
However there are landings everywhere if you can't reach it.

name: La Pesse LZ
desc:
On Chatelair airfield runway or behind Fenis castle.
If you land on the airfield, please notify aeroclub in advance. If you have aeronautical radio, use 130,000MHz, in case not - inform them in person.

name: Torgnon LZ
desc: The same as for Le Magdeleine flying site.

name: Andrate (Castagna) LZ
desc:
The same as S. Giacomo.

name: Rifugio Perugia LZ
desc:
TOP landing is also possible;
other landing options (beside San Pellegrino) are available in the valley

name: Monticchio LZ
desc: There is currently no windsock, but the landing is always towards the south (unless its a very early morning or very late evening flight where the wind direction can turn from noth)

name: Noli LZ
desc:
narrow beach
VERY crowded in season!
Landing prohibited from 1.July on (as on the whole coast)!

name: Col Bione LZ
desc:
Top landing is easy, and mostly preferred place to land.
If unable to top/land, there are fields below in Coazze (see the landing marker).

name: Gualdo Tadino LZ

Gualdo Tadino
Industrial area south

name: Toirano LZ
desc:
Landing area is quite small. Easy top landing if wind isn't too strong.
If you climb at least 200m over take off, you can cross the left valley reaching a hill on the left which is above Boissano village. A soccer field becomes visible and it is easy to land there. A hole in the fence let you exit even if gate is closed. Avoid landing if anyone is playing inside.

name: Stoanamandl LZ
desc: Vals

desc: Vals

Big field without notable obstacles.

name: Pedana Delta 3 LZ

name: Beigua LZ
desc: Top landing is suggested. Landing on last western beach of Cogoleto (Area Stoppani) is always tolerate even summertime. Between October 1st and April 30th landing is permitted on any beach.

name: S.Antonio - Costa del Mito LZ
desc: Spiaggia chilometrica e larga e libera tutto l'anno da metÃ  settembre al primo giugno. Nei mesi di giugno,luglio Ã¨ agosto Ã¨ vivamente sconsigliato l'atterraggio in spiaggia per la presenza di troppe strutture balneari e persone.

desc: Campo sportivo ai piedi del paese di Cardile.L'atterraggio Ã¨ tecnico e non alla portata di principianti per la presenza di una finestra di ingresso condizionata da alcuni ostacoli. PossibilitÃ  di diversi atterraggi a fondovalle per vele con buona efficienza.

easy landing with a lot of spot around

name: Alto LZ
desc:
44Â°06'28.91' N 8Â°00'24.20' E 604m
Large landing area but Very Tecnical because in the lee side of thermals activity. ( please contact local pilot before use it).
Strongly recommended the easy 'top landing' in big field take off area 2.

name: Madonnina Capo di Serra Bacheca LZ
Tognola LZ
desc:
It is a Big flat area, located on North-West of the town (San Martino di Castrozza). Normally the valley breeze come from South East during the day but in the evening  when the sun sets the wind could be from North. Be carefull because near it there is a helicopter landing area so just in case you hear it or see it, the good area to land is in some grass area located on South east of the San Martino di Castrozza. About the wind, keep on your  mind the same rules like for the main landing area.


TOPLANDING: It also possible to land at the takeoff site.

name: Palamonda - Colverde - San Martino di Castrozza LZ
desc: It is a Big flat area, located on North-West of the town (San Martino di Castrozza). Normally the valley breeze come from South East during the day but in the evening when the sun sets the wind could be from North. Be carefull because near it there is a helicopter landing area so just in case you hear it or see it, the good area to land is in some grass area located on South east of the San Martino di Castrozza. About the wind, keep on your mind the same rules like for the main landing area.

name: Montemale LZ
desc: Valgrana

Next to the village of Volpara there are different grassy fields that can be used for landing. The biggest is between the main road and Volpara.

desc:
The landing is on the beach below. It's tricky as the takeoff because rocky and very short. 
I recommend loosing height on the sea and land looking to east, parallel at the beach direction. Be careful of the bathers during summer.

name: Gavorrano LZ
desc:
Landing is near Filare di Gavorrano, 400 meters down takeoff. It's very long, for both paraglider and hangglider.
Also is possible the top, on the back of the takeoff.

name: Castelmauro - NorthEast LZ
desc: Landings are everywhere around Castelmauro. There's no official field, however we usually land near the street on the left for an easy recovery.

name: Castelmauro - South LZ
desc: As the other Castelmauro takeoff, there's no official landing field. We usually land near the street because of easier recovery. There are landings everywhere.

name: Le Cornate LZ
desc: Landing is on the pit below, it's large and open, no big problem.

name: Monte Lesima LZ
desc: For landing see related web site informations

desc: Landig zone: N41Â°37.305 E 014Â°15.089

desc: Big landing spot in Giano Vetusto.

name: Gallina LZ
desc:
36.948857, 15.154415
It is just in front of the takeoff. Very easy to go there even if there are no lifts at all. The only problems are the high-voltage lines. The whole agricultural area before the hill is full of cables. Only one of them is 20m high, the rest of them are 5-10 m. During the flight they mean no problem at all, they only make the landing a bit more difficult out of the landing area. It is not impossible to find other landing places but you have to be very careful.

Please do not park the cars near the landing site, leave them on the spacious parking site next to the bar (400m from the landing).
